No less than 40 km/h and no more than 60 km/h.
No less than 20 km/h and no more than 40 km/h.

question: Which driver of a vehicle violates traffic rules if all vehicles are moving at a speed of 100 km/h?
explanation: According to subparagraphs "b", "d", and "e" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", unless otherwise specified by this law, on the section of the road where movement is permitted by the corresponding traffic sign, in an uninhabited area and in a populated area at speeds exceeding 60 km/h, the following is permitted: b) Movement of vehicles of category "B": b.a) if it does not engage in towing a light trailer, on the motorway at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h, and on other roads − not exceeding 90 km/h; d) Movement of vehicles of categories "C" and "CE", as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E": d.a) on the motorway at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads − not exceeding 70 km/h; e) Movement of vehicles of subcategories "D1" and "D1E" on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the green car.
Only the driver of the white minibus.
Only the drivers of the cargo truck and the white minibus.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a "B" category vehicle on this section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, on the section of road where movement is permitted at a speed greater than 60 km/h between an uninhabited area and an inhabited area, the following is allowed: b) Movement of "B" category vehicles: b.a) if it does not carry out the towing of a light trailer, at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h on the motorway, and not exceeding 90 km/h on other roads.

question: In this situation, is it prohibited for the driver of a "C1" subcategory truck to continue moving in the direction of the arrow if they are traveling at a speed of 70 km/h?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Rules," except for the cases established by this law, on the section of the road between an uninhabited and inhabited area where movement is allowed with a speed of more than 60 km/h according to the corresponding road sign, the following is permitted: d) the movement of vehicles belonging to categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E": d.a) on the highway at no more than 80 km/h, and on other roads - at no more than 70 km/h. According to paragraph 11 of article 31 of the same law, in an uninhabited area, as well as on the section of the roadway in an inhabited area where movement is allowed at speeds exceeding 80 km/h, the driver must drive as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway. It is prohibited to occupy the left lane when the right lane is free, except in cases of bypassing an obstacle, turning left, or making a U-turn.

question: In an uninhabited area, within the effective zone of the given road sign, a category "B" vehicle driver is allowed to move no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of point 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise provided for by this law, on the section of the road where traffic is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, between an uninhabited point and an inhabited point, the following is permitted: b) the movement of category "B" vehicles: b.a) if it does not engage in towing a light trailer, at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h on a motorway, and not exceeding 90 km/h on other roads. According to point 5.3 of the first annex of the same law, the road sign 5.3. "Motorway" refers to the road designated exclusively for the movement of cars and motorcycles.

question: What is the maximum speed permitted for a driver of a light trailer “B” category vehicle after the end of a populated area sign?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b.b" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", unless otherwise specified by this law, the movement of category "B" vehicles is permitted on the section of road between an uninhabited area and an inhabited area where movement is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h if it is towing a light trailer, on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h. According to paragraph 3.24 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 3.24 "Maximum Speed Limit" prohibits movement at a speed exceeding that indicated on the sign (km/h), and according to the note "e" of the same paragraph, the effectiveness of signs 3.16, 3.20, 3.22, 3.24, 3.26–3.30 extends from the respective sign to the nearest intersection following the location of the sign, and in the absence of an intersection in an inhabited area – to the end of the inhabited area.

question: Which driver of a vehicle moving in that direction is violating traffic rules?
explanation: According to subpoints "a" and "g.g" of the first paragraph of Article 38 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," on the motorway, at the entrance and exit of the motorway: a) The movement of pedestrians, animals, bicycles, mopeds, two-wheeled electric scooters, vehicles, and any other transportation means that differ from vehicles and their trailers is prohibited. g.g) The driver is prohibited from driving beyond the second lane with a freight-carrying vehicle (with or without trailers) whose permitted maximum weight exceeds 3.5 tons or with trailer vehicles whose total length is more than 7 meters.

answers.answer: Driver of a vehicle in the "CE" category only.
Only tractor and "CE" category vehicle drivers.
Only drivers of "CE" and "B" category vehicles.

question: What is the maximum speed limit for a driver of a "B1" category vehicle in an unpopulated area on the given section of the road?
explanation: According to paragraph "a" of point 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, except for the cases established by this law, on the sections of the road between uninhabited and inhabited areas where movement is permitted at a speed of more than 60 km/h by the relevant road sign, the movement of category "A" vehicles, as well as category "A1" and "B1" subcategories, is allowed on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed limit for the driver of a trailer category "BE" vehicle in an uninhabited area on this section of the road?
explanation: According to subpoint "g" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, except for cases stipulated by this law, on the section of the road where movement is allowed at a speed of more than 60 km/h between an uninhabited area and a populated area, the movement of vehicles of category "BE" is permitted on all roads at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed limit for a driver of a "BE" category vehicle on a motorway?
explanation: According to sub-point "g" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except in cases established by this law, on the stretch of road between a non-populated area and a populated area, where movement is permitted at a speed exceeding 60 km/h indicated by the relevant road sign, the movement of vehicles in the "BE" category is allowed on all roads at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h.

question: On this section of the road, a driver of a category "C" heavy vehicle is allowed to move no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph "d.a" of point 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," in addition to the cases established by this law, on the section of the road where movement is permitted at speeds exceeding 60 km/h between uninhabited and inhabited areas, the following is allowed: d) Movement of vehicles in categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E": d.a) on highways at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads - at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h.

question: Which vehicle driver violates traffic rules if all vehicles are moving at a speed of 100 km/h?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", except for the cases established by this law, on the section of the road where movement is permitted at a speed exceeding 60 km/h between an unpopulated area and a populated area, the following is allowed: d) the movement of vehicles of category "C" and "CE", as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E": d.a) at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h on the motorway, and no more than 70 km/h on other roads.

answers.answer: Only light and heavy vehicle drivers
Only light vehicle and bus drivers

question: When transporting passengers by a specially equipped vehicle, the driver of a "C" category freight vehicle is allowed to drive on the motorway, not exceeding:
explanation: According to paragraph "d" of point 7 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, in the section of the road where movement is allowed at a speed of more than 60 km/h between an uninhabited point and a populated point, the following is permitted: d) Movement of vehicles in categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E": d.a) at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h on the motorway, and not exceeding 70 km/h on other roads; d.b) when transporting passengers by trolley, at a speed not exceeding 60 km/h on all roads.

question: Will the driver of a category "CE" freight vehicle violate the traffic rules if he continues to move at a speed of 70 km/h on this section of the road?
explanation: According to point "d.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for cases established by this law, on the section of the road where traffic is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, on the territory between an uninhabited area and a populated area, the movement of vehicles in categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E," is permitted on highways at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h. According to point 7.2 of the first annex of this law, the road sign 7.2 "Recommended Speed" indicates the speed recommended for traffic on the given section of the road. The sign is installed at the beginning of the road. The sign's effect extends to the nearest intersection, and together with the warning sign, it covers the entire length of the dangerous area.

question: The driver of a category "A" vehicle is allowed to drive on the highway for no more than:
explanation: According to point "a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, except for cases established by this law, in the section of the road where traffic is permitted at speeds exceeding 60 km/h between uninhabited and inhabited areas, the movement of "A" category as well as "A1" and "B1" subcategories of vehicles is allowed on all roads at a speed of no more than 80 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for the driver of a "C" category truck on the given section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Rules," except for the cases established by this law, on the section of the road where movement is permitted at a speed greater than 60 km/h in uninhabited and inhabited areas, the movement of vehicles of categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E," is allowed on the highway at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads − at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h.

question: The driver of a vehicle in the "D1E" subcategory is allowed to operate on the highway no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph "e" of point 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, on the road section between an uninhabited area and an inhabited area where movement is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h according to the relevant traffic sign, the movement of vehicles in the "D1" and "D1E" subcategories is permitted on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a "D" category bus driver in the area of the given traffic sign?
explanation: According to paragraph 6 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise established by this law, the movement of vehicles in populated areas is permitted at a speed of no more than 60 km/h, while in residential areas it is permitted at a speed of no more than 20 km/h. If road conditions in the populated area allow for high-speed movement, the speed limit may be increased on certain sections of the road by placing the appropriate road sign.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a "D" category bus driver in the area of the given road sign?
explanation: According to subparagraph "v" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, on the section of the road between non-residential and residential areas where movement is permitted with a corresponding traffic sign at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of vehicles of categories "D" and "DE" is allowed on highways at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads at a speed not exceeding 70 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed limit for a driver of a "C1" subcategory vehicle while towing a yellow car in an uninhabited area?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 8 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise specified by this law, the movement of a mechanical vehicle that is towing another mechanical vehicle is permitted in populated or unpopulated areas at a speed not exceeding 50 km/h.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a "D1" subcategory vehicle on this section of the road?
explanation: According to paragraph "e" of the 7th point of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, in areas without habitation and in populated areas on the section of the road where traffic is allowed at speeds exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of vehicles in the "D1" and "D1E" subcategories is permitted on all roads at speeds not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: In the given situation, does the driver of a category "C" freight vehicle moving in the direction of the arrow violate traffic rules?
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of article 31 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, in uninhabited and inhabited areas, on the section of the roadway where movement is permitted at a speed exceeding 80 km/h, the driver must drive as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway. It is prohibited to occupy the left lane when the right lane is free, except in cases of overtaking obstacles, turning left, or making a U-turn.

question: In uninhabited areas, under conditions of insufficient visibility, or in cases of high intensity of vehicular traffic, pedestrians (except for those walking in a marching formation) who are moving on the roadway (as close as possible to the edge of the roadway) should, as much as possible, move:
explanation: According to paragraph 5 of article 24 of the law on "Road Traffic" of Georgia, in order to ensure the safety of movement, specifically in conditions of poor visibility or in cases of high intensity of vehicular traffic, pedestrians (except in cases of walking in a procession) who are moving on the road surface must, as much as possible, move in a single line. According to paragraph 6 of the same article, in the cases specified in paragraphs 2, 4, and 5 of this article, pedestrians must stay as close as possible to the edge of the road surface while moving.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a "C" category heavy vehicle to continue driving in this section of the road within a populated area?
explanation: According to paragraph 6 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise stipulated by this law, the movement of vehicles in populated areas is permitted at speeds not exceeding 60 km/h, while in residential zones it is not to exceed 20 km/h. If road conditions in a populated area allow for higher speed traffic, the speed limit may be increased on certain sections of the road by installing the appropriate traffic sign. According to point 5.23.1 of the first annex of this law, the traffic sign 5.23.1 "Beginning of a populated area" indicates the beginning of a populated area where the established rules for movement in populated areas apply.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a "B" category light vehicle driver to continue driving in a populated area on this section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 8 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise stipulated by this law, the movement of a mechanical vehicle that is towing another mechanical vehicle is permitted in populated or unpopulated areas, at a speed not exceeding 50 km/h.

question: If there is a traffic light designated for pedestrians at the crosswalk, the pedestrian must comply with the following when crossing the crosswalk:
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph 7 of Article 24 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," when crossing at a pedestrian crossing, if there is a traffic light intended for pedestrians, the pedestrian must comply with the signals of this traffic light.

answers.answer: Requirements for traffic light signal lights
Requirements for pedestrian traffic light signals

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a "B" category vehicle in a non-built-up area on the specified section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 7 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for cases stipulated by this law, on the section of the road between an uninhabited point and an inhabited point where movement is permitted at a speed higher than 60 km/h by the relevant road sign, it is allowed: b) For vehicles of category B: b.a) if they are not towing a light trailer, on highways - no more than 110 km/h, and on other roads - no more than 90 km/h. According to point 7.2 of the first annex of this law, the road sign 7.2 "Recommended Speed" indicates the speed at which movement is recommended on the given section of the road. The sign is placed at the beginning of the road, and its action extends to the nearest intersection, and along the entire length of the hazardous area when accompanied by a warning sign.

question: Which of the road conditions listed below should the driver consider when changing the speed of the vehicle?
explanation: According to Paragraph 2 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, when changing the speed of a vehicle, the driver must take into account the road conditions (the terrain of the location, the condition of the road and the vehicle, its load, atmospheric conditions, traffic intensity, insufficient or limited visibility) in order to reduce speed if necessary, as well as before any obstacle that he can foresee, and stop if necessary.

answers.answer: Only the relief of the place and the intensity of movement
Only atmospheric conditions, as well as insufficient or limited visibility.
Only the condition of the road and the means of transportation.
All road conditions listed in this ticket.

question: What is the maximum speed at which a passenger transport vehicle of category "C" can travel on the road indicated by the given road sign?
explanation: According to point 5.1 of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the road sign 5.1 "Motorway" indicates a motorway where the rules governing traffic on motorways apply. The sign is placed at the beginning of the motorway or nearby, accompanied by sign 8.1.1. Additionally, according to point 7 of article 33 of this law, subsection “d.b,” except for cases established by this law, on the road section between an inhabited and an uninhabited area where movement is permitted at speeds exceeding 60 km/h by the corresponding road sign, the movement of vehicles of categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E," is allowed, provided that in the case of transporting passengers by a trailer, the speed does not exceed 60 km/h on all roads.

question: The movement of "T" and "S" category vehicles is permitted in the area of effect of the given traffic sign for no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph 3.24 of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road sign 3.24 "Maximum Speed Limit" prohibits movement at a speed greater than that indicated on the sign (km/h). According to paragraph 8 of article 33 of the same law, unless otherwise provided for in this law, the movement of "T" and "S" category vehicles is permitted on all roads in populated or unpopulated areas at a speed not exceeding 40 km/h.

question: Movement with AM category vehicles is allowed in the zone of the given road sign for no more than:
explanation: According to point 3.24 of the first annex of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, road sign 3.24 "Maximum Speed Limit" prohibits movement at a speed greater than that indicated on the sign (km/h). According to point 7 of Article 33 of the same law, except for the cases established by this law, in unpopulated areas, as well as in populated areas on the road sections where movement is allowed at a speed greater than 60 km/h by the corresponding road sign, the following is permitted: b) Movement of vehicles of category "AM" on the roadway at a speed not exceeding 45 km/h.

question: The given road sign:
explanation: According to paragraph 3.25 of the first annex of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, the road sign 3.25 "End of Maximum Speed Limit" indicates the end of the area of effect of sign 3.24 ("Maximum Speed Limit").

answers.answer: Prohibits movement at a speed greater than that indicated on the sign.
It indicates the end of the zone of action of the maximum speed limit road sign.
Indicates the speed at which movement is recommended on the given section of the road.

question: Which of the given road signs is placed in an uninhabited area, 150-300 meters before a railway level crossing without a barrier, on the left side of the road?
explanation: According to paragraphs 1.1, 1.2, and 1.41-1.46 of the first annex to the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic": 1.1. "Railway Crossing with Barrier" - warns of approaching a railway crossing with a barrier. 1.2. "Railway Crossing without Barrier" - warns of approaching a railway crossing without a barrier. 1.4.1–1.4.6. "Approaching Railway Crossing" - additionally warns the driver about approaching a railway crossing in an unpopulated area. According to subparagraphs "a" and "v" of the note of the first section of this annex: a) Signs 1.1, 1.2, 1.5–1.34 are installed in an unpopulated area at a distance of 150−300 meters before the hazardous section, in a populated area – at a distance of 50–100 meters. If necessary, signs are installed at other distances as indicated on board 8.1.1; v) Signs 1.4.1−1.4.3 are installed on the right side of the road, while signs 1.4.4−1.4.6 are installed on the left side of the road. Signs 1.4.1 and 1.4.4 are installed in the direction of traffic together with primary and repeat signs 1.1 or 1.2, signs 1.4.3 and 1.4.6 are installed in the direction of traffic together with repeat signs 1.1 or 1.2, while signs 1.4.2 and 1.4.5 are installed independently at equal distances between the primary and repeat signs 1.1 or 1.2.

question: In the zone of action of the given traffic sign, movement with category "B" vehicles without a trailer is allowed for no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph 5.1 of the first annex to the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," road sign 5.1 "Motorway" indicates a motorway on which the norms regulating traffic movement on motorways are applicable. The sign is placed at the beginning of the motorway or in its vicinity with plate 8.1.1. According to subparagraph "b.a" of paragraph 7 of Article 33 of this law, except for cases established by this law, on the section of the road between uninhabited and inhabited areas where movement is permitted with the relevant road sign at speeds exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of "B" category vehicles is allowed if they are not towing a light trailer, at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h on the motorway.

question: Movement with "C" and "CE" category vehicles is allowed in the area of the given traffic sign for no more than:
explanation: According to paragraph 5.1 of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the road sign 5.1 "Motorway" indicates a motorway where the regulations governing traffic on the motorway apply. The sign is placed at the beginning of the motorway or nearby, along with plaque 8.1.1. Furthermore, according to sub-paragraph "d.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of this law, aside from conditions established by this law, on the section of road between an uninhabited area and an inhabited area where movement is permitted at speeds exceeding 60 km/h as indicated by the relevant road sign, the movement of vehicles in categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E," is allowed on the motorway at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: Movement with vehicles of the "C1" and "C1E" subcategory is allowed in the area of the given road sign, not exceeding:
explanation: According to paragraph 5.1 of the first annex of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, road sign 5.1 "Motorway" indicates a motorway where the requirements for regulating traffic on the motorway apply. The sign is installed at the beginning of the motorway or in its vicinity, along with sign 8.1.1. According to subparagraph "d.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the same law, except for the cases established by this law, in uninhabited areas as well as in inhabited areas on the road section where movement is permitted with a corresponding sign at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, traffic is permitted for vehicles of categories C and CE, as well as subcategories C1 and C1E, on motorways at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: If there is no pedestrian traffic light at the crosswalk or it is not working, but the movement of vehicles is regulated by a traffic light, pedestrians should not cross the roadway:
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 7 of article 24 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, when crossing a pedestrian crossing, if there is no traffic light for pedestrians or it is not functioning, but the movement of vehicles is regulated by a traffic light, a pedestrian must not enter the roadway until the traffic light or signals from the traffic controller allow movement of vehicles on that roadway.

answers.answer: Before determining the distance to the approaching vehicle, its speed, and ensuring safe crossing.
Before the traffic light or traffic controller signals allow the movement of vehicles in this lane.

question: Did the driver of the light vehicle violate the traffic rules while moving in the direction of the arrow, if the driver of the yellow bus has already started overtaking?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph 3 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic", before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of article 20 and article 32 of this law, that none of the drivers of the vehicles approaching from behind has begun to overtake.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a white car to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subsection "b" of paragraph 3 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before starting an overtaking maneuver, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements set by paragraph 2 of Article 20 and Article 32 of this law, that the driver of the vehicle traveling in the same lane ahead has not signaled an intention to overtake another vehicle. It is prohibited to overtake any vehicle that is itself performing an overtaking maneuver or circumventing an obstacle. Also, according to subsection "a.g" of paragraph 9 of this article, overtaking is prohibited at an intersection that differs from a roundabout or directly in front of this intersection, except when overtaking is performed at a regulated intersection without entering the opposing traffic lane. According to paragraph 2 of Article 36 of this law, an intersection regulated by signals from a traffic light or traffic controller is considered a regulated intersection.

question: In the absence of a pedestrian crossing at the intersection, a pedestrian must cross the roadway:
explanation: According to paragraph 8 of article 24 of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," a pedestrian must cross the roadway at pedestrian crossing points, including above-ground and underground crossings, and in their absence – at an intersection, along a sidewalk or shoulder.

answers.answer: Only along the shortest trajectory to the designated location.
Only along the sidewalk or lane.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of the passenger vehicle prohibited from overtaking?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at a railway crossing and within 100 meters in front of it, except in cases where traffic at these locations is controlled by a type of traffic light used at intersections.

question: Does the driver of a light vehicle have the right to continue moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 18 of article 31 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases provided in paragraph 1 of article 37 and paragraph 2 of article 43 of this law, the movement of mechanical vehicles is prohibited on the roadside, bicycle lanes, bike paths, sidewalks, and pedestrian paths. Observing safety measures, it is allowed for a mechanical vehicle carrying goods to approach the enterprise or object located directly adjacent to the roadside, bicycle lane, bike path, sidewalk, and pedestrian path in the shortest way possible if no other option is available. The prohibition established by this paragraph does not apply to vehicles of road maintenance and utility services.

question: If there is no pedestrian crossing or intersection in the visibility zone, a pedestrian is allowed to cross the road perpendicularly to the axis of the roadway in the section where:
explanation: According to paragraph 8 of article 24 of the law of Georgia on "Traffic," if there is no pedestrian crossing or intersection in the visibility zone, crossing the road is allowed perpendicularly to the road's centerline in sections where there is no dividing line or fence and the road is clearly visible from both sides.

answers.answer: The dividing line is clear, and the road is visible from both sides.
There is no dividing line or fence, and the road is clearly visible from both sides.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a white light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by encroaching into the opposing traffic lane, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Where there is no pedestrian crossing, a pedestrian must cross on the roadway.
explanation: According to paragraph 8 of article 24 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," where there are no pedestrian crossings, a pedestrian should not cross the roadway until determining the distance to the approaching vehicle, its speed, and ensuring the safety of crossing.

answers.answer: Only after determining the distance to the approaching vehicle
Only after determining the speed of the approaching vehicle.
Only after ensuring the safety of the crossing.
After ensuring the distance to the approaching vehicle, as well as determining its speed and ensuring the safety of the crossing

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a gray light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph "a" and "a.b" of subparagraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, overtaking is prohibited at an intersection that is not circular or directly in front of such an intersection, except in cases where overtaking is conducted on a road where the driver is granted the right of priority at the intersection. According to paragraph 1.7.1 of the first chapter of the first annex of this law, road sign 1.7.1 "Crossing with a secondary road" indicates a crossing with or joining of a road where the driver is obliged to yield the right of way.

question: Does the driver of a green light vehicle have the right to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraphs "a" and "a.b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at an intersection differing from a roundabout or directly before such an intersection, except in cases where the overtaking is carried out on a road where the driver is granted the right of priority at the intersection. According to point 1.5 of the second appendix of the same law, horizontal road markings 1.5 separate opposing traffic flows on a road with two or three lanes; it indicates the boundary of a traffic lane when there are two or more lanes designated for one direction of travel. Crossing the 1.5 line is permitted from any side.

question: Does the driver of a gray light vehicle have the right to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraphs "a" and "a.b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at an intersection that differs from a roundabout or immediately in front of this intersection, except in cases where overtaking is performed on a road where the driver is granted the right of priority at the intersection. According to paragraph 1.1 of the first part of annex 2 of this law, horizontal road marking 1.1 separates opposing traffic flows and indicates the border of the lane or the border of the roadway where entry is prohibited on a hazardous section of the road; it indicates the boundary of the stopping place for vehicles and the edge of the roadway that does not belong to a motorway under traffic conditions. Crossing line 1.1 is prohibited. It is permissible to cross the edge line indicating the roadway and the line 1.1 located on the driver's right side to park the vehicle on the roadside.

question: Does a pedestrian have the right to delay crossing, pause, or stop on the roadway after stepping onto it, if it does not relate to ensuring traffic safety?
explanation: According to paragraph 10 of article 24 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Movement", after leaving the roadway, a pedestrian should not delay crossing, should not linger or stop on it, unless it relates to ensuring the safety of movement.

question: Does the driver of the red car have the right to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking must be carried out from the left side. Overtaking from the right side is allowed if the driver being overtaken has signaled an intention to turn left and has positioned their vehicle in such a way as to turn onto another road, enter an adjacent area, or stop on that side.

question: Does the driver of the white light vehicle have the right to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at railway crossings and within 100 meters in front of them, except in cases where traffic is regulated by signals used at intersections. According to point 1.1 of the first chapter of the first appendix of this law (Warning Signs), road sign 1.1 "Railway Crossing with Barrier" warns about approaching a railway crossing with a barrier. According to subparagraph "b" of the note in the same chapter, signs 1.1, 1.2, 1.10, 1.11, 1.23, 1.24, and 1.26 are repeated in uninhabited areas, while signs 1.24 and 1.26 are also used in inhabited areas. The second sign is placed not less than 50 meters from the beginning of the hazardous section.

question: Is it prohibited for a light vehicle driver to overtake in the direction of the arrow in an uninhabited area if a tractor is moving at a speed of 30 km/h?
explanation: According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the "Traffic Law" of Georgia, in accordance with the 11th paragraph of Article 31 of the law, in areas where movement is permitted at speeds greater than 80 km/h, a driver must drive as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway in both urban and non-urban areas. It is prohibited to occupy the left lane when the right lane is free, except when circumventing an obstacle, turning left, or making a U-turn. According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the same law, overtaking must be carried out from the left side. Overtaking from the right side is permitted if the driver being overtaken has signaled their intention to turn left and has oriented their vehicle in such a way that it will turn onto another road or enter the adjacent area of the road, or stop on that side.

question: Which driver's vehicle is prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the Georgian Law on Road Traffic, overtaking should be carried out from the left side. Overtaking from the right side is allowed only if the driver being overtaken has signaled their intention to turn left and has directed their vehicle in such a way as to turn onto another road, enter an adjacent area, or stop on that side. According to the 11th paragraph of Article 31 of the same law, in an unpopulated area and also within a populated area on the section of the roadway where a speed of over 80 km/h is permitted, the driver must travel as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway. It is prohibited to occupy the left lane when the right lane is free, except in cases of avoiding an obstacle, turning left, or making a U-turn. According to paragraph 5.25 of the 5th chapter (special indication signs) of the first annex of the same law, road sign 5.25 "Beginning of a populated area" indicates the beginning of a populated area where the traffic rules established for populated areas do not apply.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the green car.
Only the driver of the yellow car.

question: Which driver's violation of traffic rules occurs when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, overtaking must be done from the left side. Overtaking from the right side is permitted if the driver being overtaken has signaled their intention to turn left and has directed their vehicle in such a manner as to turn onto another road, enter the area adjacent to the road, or stop on that side. According to subparagraphs "a.a" and "a.b" of paragraph 9 of the same article, overtaking is prohibited at an intersection with a roundabout, as opposed to other intersections or directly in front of such intersections, except: a.a) in the case of overtaking permitted from the right as provided for by this law; a.b) in the case where overtaking occurs on a road where the driver is granted the right of way at an intersection.

answers.answer: Only the driver of a lightweight vehicle.

question: Does a truck driver with a maximum permissible mass of over 3.5 tons have the right to overtake in the direction of an arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 3.22 of the 3rd chapter (Prohibitory Signs) of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the traffic sign 3.22 "Overtaking by a truck is prohibited" prohibits overtaking other vehicles with a truck weighing more than 3.5 tons (except for vehicles moving at a speed of less than 30 km/h) and also prohibits overtaking other vehicles with a tractor (except for public transport and bicycles). Additionally, according to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of the same law, overtaking is prohibited at locations designated by overtaking prohibition signs or markings, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Which driver is prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow if the middle lane of the given road is used for traffic in both directions?
explanation: According to paragraph 7 of Article 31 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the driver of a vehicle on a two-way road with three traffic lanes (excluding road marking 1.9) must not move to the edge lane of the roadway where traffic in the opposite direction is taking place. If the middle lane on a three-lane road is used for movement in both directions, exiting this lane is permitted only for the purposes of overtaking, circumventing an obstacle, turning left, or making a U-turn.

answers.answer: Only the driver of a light vehicle.

question: Did the driver of the light vehicle violate traffic rules when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 2 of Article 25 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", the following requirements must be fulfilled at the pedestrian crossing in accordance with the requirements established by paragraph 6 of Article 21, paragraph 2 of Article 33, and paragraph 11 of Article 34 of this law: b) if the movement of vehicles is not regulated by either a traffic light or a traffic officer, the driver must properly reduce their speed when approaching a pedestrian crossing to avoid creating a hazard for pedestrians entering or exiting this crossing, and if necessary, must stop and allow pedestrians to cross. According to paragraph 11 of Article 34 of this law, a vehicle may overtake another vehicle that is approaching a pedestrian crossing or has stopped directly in front of this crossing only at a sufficiently reduced speed in order to ensure timely stopping at the crossing if a pedestrian is present. Overtaking is prohibited at a pedestrian crossing if a pedestrian is crossing it.

question: If a pedestrian is unable to cross the road in time, they have the right to stop.
explanation: According to paragraph 10 of Article 24 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations", a pedestrian who has not managed to cross the road must stop on a safety island, on a dividing line or lane between traffic flows moving in opposite directions and may continue to cross only after ensuring the safety of further movement, taking into account the signals of traffic lights or a traffic controller.

answers.answer: Only on the island of safety.
On a dividing strip or line for transport flows moving only in opposite directions.
Like on a safety island, also on a dividing strip or line between opposing moving traffic flows.

question: Is it prohibited for a driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to part "a.b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," overtaking is prohibited at intersections different from circular motion intersections or directly in front of such intersections, except in cases where overtaking occurs on a road where the driver is granted the right of priority at the intersection. Furthermore, according to paragraph 10 of the same article, the prohibitions defined in parts "a" and "b" of paragraph 9 do not apply to cases of overtaking of two-wheeled bicycles, mopeds, and two-wheeled motorbikes without a sidecar.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 9 subparagraph "a.b" of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at an intersection that is different from a roundabout or directly before this intersection, except in cases where overtaking occurs on a road where the driver has the right of priority at the intersection. According to paragraph 10 of the same article, the prohibitions defined in subparagraphs "a" and "b" of paragraph 9 of this article do not apply to cases of overtaking of two-wheeled bicycles, mopeds, and two-wheeled motorbikes without a sidecar.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a green vehicle to perform an overtaking maneuver by crossing into the opposite lane?
explanation: According to point 1.15 of the first chapter (warning signs) of the first annex of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," road sign 1.15 "Steep Ascent" provides a warning regarding approaching a section of road with a steep incline. In accordance with subparagraph "e" of point 9 of article 34 of this law, overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by entering the oncoming traffic lane, considering the requirements established by point 3 of this article.

question: Will the driver of the blue light vehicle violate the traffic rules if they are moving in the direction of the arrow, given that the distance to the top of the hill is 80 meters?
explanation: According to paragraph 1.15 of the first section (Warning Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Movement," the traffic sign 1.15 "Steep Ascent" provides a warning regarding approaching a section of road with a steep ascent. Furthermore, according to sub-paragraph "e" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of this law, overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by entering the opposite movement lane, considering the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a red vehicle to perform an overtaking maneuver by crossing into the opposing lane?
explanation: According to paragraph 1.15 of the first section (warning signs) of the first annex to the law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," the road sign 1.15. "Steep Incline" provides a warning about approaching a section of road with a steep incline. Additionally, according to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the same law, it is prohibited to overtake under conditions of limited visibility by entering the opposing traffic lane, considering the requirements established in paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Is it prohibited for the driver of a green vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 1.15 of the first chapter (Warning Signs) of the first annex of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," road sign 1.15. "Steep Ascent" provides a warning regarding approaching a section of road with a steep ascent. Additionally, according to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of this law, overtaking is prohibited under limited visibility conditions by leaving the lane of oncoming traffic, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Will the driver of the white car violate traffic rules if executing the maneuver indicated by the arrow, while a pedestrian has started crossing from the left side?
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of article 34 of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," a vehicle may overtake another vehicle that is approaching a pedestrian crossing or that has stopped immediately before that crossing, only at a sufficiently reduced speed to ensure timely stopping at the crossing in case a pedestrian is detected. Overtaking at a pedestrian crossing is prohibited if a pedestrian is present on it.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of a light vehicle prohibited from overtaking?
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of article 34 of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," a vehicle may overtake another vehicle that is approaching a pedestrian crossing or has stopped immediately before that crossing only at a sufficiently reduced speed to ensure a timely stop at the crossing in case a pedestrian is encountered. Overtaking is prohibited at a pedestrian crossing if a pedestrian is crossing it.

question: Does the driver of the white light vehicle have the right to initiate an overtaking maneuver if the bus driver has their left turn signal on and has begun the turn?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph 3 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of Article 20 and Article 32 of this law, that no driver of a vehicle approaching from behind has started to overtake.

question: Does the driver of a truck have the right to start an overtaking maneuver if the driver of a passenger car has their left turn signal on and has begun to overtake?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph 3 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of article 20 and article 32 of this law, that no driver of a vehicle approaching from behind has begun overtaking.

question: Is it forbidden for the driver to park the vehicle at the indicated spot with an arrow?
explanation: According to the subparagraph "v" of paragraph 7 of article 37 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, it is prohibited to park vehicles on the roadway marked by road signs 2.1, 5.1, and 5.3 in uninhabited areas, as well as on the roadway in inhabited areas where the speed limit is over 80 km/h, except in specifically designated places.

question: Which of the following circumstances indicates the driver's fatigue while operating a vehicle?
explanation: When driving a vehicle, signs of the driver's fatigue include both heavy eyelids and frequent yawning, as well as a deterioration in reaction time.

answers.answer: Only the heaviness of the eyelids.
Any circumstance listed in this ticket

question: Before starting to accelerate, the driver must ensure:
explanation: According to subparagraphs "a", "b", and "c" of paragraph 3 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of article 20 and article 32 of this law, that: a) no driver of a vehicle approaching from behind has begun to overtake; b) the driver of the vehicle moving ahead in the same lane has not signaled, indicating that he intends to overtake another vehicle. Overtaking is prohibited for any vehicle that is already engaged in overtaking or maneuvering around an obstacle; c) he can carry out the overtaking in such a way that it does not create a danger or an obstacle for other road users. He must also ensure that the lane he intends to move into is clear at a sufficient distance and that the speed ratio of the two vehicles allows for overtaking within a sufficiently short time.

answers.answer: Only in that none of the drivers of the vehicles coming behind him had started to overtake.
Only in that the driver of the vehicle moving ahead in the same lane did not signal that he intends to overtake another vehicle.
Only in that the lane of movement they intend to exit is free for a sufficient distance, and the speed ratio of the two vehicles allows for overtaking in a sufficiently short time.
In all the circumstances listed in this ticket.

question: Is it allowed to overtake a vehicle from the right side?
explanation: According to the first paragraph of Article 34 of the Georgian Law on Road Traffic, overtaking must be done from the left side. Overtaking from the right side is permitted if the driver being overtaken has signaled their intention to turn left and has positioned their vehicle in such a way that they are about to turn onto another road, enter an adjacent area, or stop on that side.

answers.answer: It is permitted if the driver being overtaken has given a signal of intent to turn left and has directed their vehicle in order to turn onto another road, or to enter an adjacent area of the road, or to stop on this side.

question: Is it permissible to overtake the vehicle that is approaching the pedestrian crossing on the roadway as indicated, or which has stopped immediately in front of this crossing?
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of article 34 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," a vehicle is allowed to overtake another vehicle that is approaching a pedestrian crossing or has stopped immediately in front of this crossing only at a sufficiently reduced speed to ensure that it can stop in time at the crossing in the event of a pedestrian being present. Overtaking is prohibited at a pedestrian crossing if a pedestrian is crossing there.

answers.answer: It is permissible if a pedestrian is not moving on the pedestrian crossing, provided that the speed is sufficiently reduced to ensure timely stopping at the crossing in case of encountering pedestrians.
Overtaking is prohibited on pedestrian crossings and at least 100 meters in front of them.
It is only permitted in uninhabited areas, on roads where the maximum allowed speed limit is more than 60 km/h.

question: Which driver of a vehicle is not prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow if the given road does not serve the adjacent areas?
explanation: According to point 3.22 of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road sign 3.22 "Overtaking by a truck is prohibited" prohibits overtaking by a freight vehicle with a permissible maximum mass exceeding 3.5 tons of any other vehicle (except for vehicles moving at a speed of less than 30 km/h), as well as overtaking by a tractor of any other vehicle (except for trailers and bicycles). According to point 5 of Article 38 of the same law, when applying points 1-3 of this article, roads designated for vehicular traffic and marked with road sign 5.3 are considered equivalent to highways, provided they do not serve adjacent areas. According to point 5.3 of the same annex, road sign 5.3 "Motor road" refers to a road intended solely for the movement of cars and motorcycles.

question: Is it prohibited for a light vehicle driver to move in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of Georgia's "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited at locations defined by overtaking prohibition signs or markings, taking into account the requirements established in paragraph 3 of this article. According to paragraph 3.20 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 3.20 "Overtaking is prohibited" prohibits overtaking of all types of mechanical vehicles (except for vehicles moving at a speed lower than 30 km/h). Overtaking is allowed without crossing into the opposing traffic lane for a two-wheeled motorcycle, moped, and bicycle.

question: Which driver's vehicle moving in that direction is violating traffic rules?
explanation: According to point 3.20 of the first annex of the "Traffic Regulations" law of Georgia, road sign 3.20 "Overtaking is prohibited” prohibits overtaking by all types of mechanical vehicles (except for vehicles moving at a speed of less than 30 km/h). Overtaking is allowed without crossing into the oncoming lane for a non-motorized motorcycle, moped, and bicycle. According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 6 of article 45 of the same law, towing with a motorcycle without a sidecar is prohibited, as well as the towing of such a motorcycle.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the red car.
Only the driver of the black car.

question: Will the driver of a light vehicle violate traffic rules when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 18 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking, circumventing, or giving way to an operational vehicle that is stopped with its blue flashing special light on, or a special vehicle that is stopped with its orange or yellow flashing special light on, a slowly moving technical service vehicle, or a vehicle of a road maintenance company, is allowed from both the right and the left, taking into account its location, situation, and danger on the roadway, regardless of the road signs and horizontal road markings applicable in that section of the road. According to point 4.2.2 of chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of the first annex of the same law, road sign 4.2.2 "Overtaking around an obstacle from the left" indicates the direction only for bypassing a dividing line, a safety island, or any obstacle from the left. According to the first paragraph of the second annex of the same law, road markings establish specific regimes and order of movement, serve as a means of visual orientation for the driver, and can be used independently, as well as in conjunction with other technical means of organizing road traffic. If the meaning of temporary road signs and markings displayed at a transfer station is contradictory, the driver shall be guided by the road signs.

question: Does the driver of the blue light car violate overtaking rules if the driver of the red light car has begun to overtake?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 3 of Article 34 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of Article 20 and Article 32 of this law, that the driver of the vehicle ahead in the same lane has not given a signal indicating an intention to overtake another vehicle. Overtaking a vehicle that is overtaking or maneuvering around an obstacle is prohibited. Furthermore, according to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 9 of this article, overtaking is prohibited for the vehicle that is overtaking or maneuvering around an obstacle, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article.

question: Is it prohibited for a light vehicle driver to overtake in the direction of the arrow if a tractor is moving at a speed of 25 km/h?
explanation: According to paragraph "d" of point 9 of article 34 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, overtaking is prohibited at locations marked with an overtaking prohibition sign or marking, considering the requirements set forth in point 3 of this article. According to point 3.20 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 3.20 "Overtaking is prohibited" prohibits overtaking of all types of mechanical vehicles (except for those moving at a speed of less than 30 km/h). Overtaking is allowed without crossing into the oncoming traffic lane for a bicycle, moped, or motorcycle without a sidecar.

question: It is permitted to exit onto the roadway to board a vehicle from the elevated boarding platform (stop).
explanation: According to paragraph 13 of article 24 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," exiting from the elevated boarding platform to the roadway for boarding a vehicle is only allowed after the vehicle has come to a stop. When alighting from a vehicle, the pedestrian must immediately clear the roadway.

answers.answer: Only after the stopping of the vehicle.
In advance, upon the appearance of the means of transport.

question: Which driver's movement is prohibited in the direction of the arrow if the tractor is moving at a speed of 25 km/h and the moped at a speed of 35 km/h?
explanation: According to paragraph "d" of point 9 of article 34 of the "Road Traffic" law of Georgia, overtaking is prohibited at locations marked with a no overtaking sign or indication, considering the requirements established by point 3 of this article. According to point 3.20 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 3.20 "Overtaking is prohibited" prohibits overtaking all types of mechanical vehicles (except for those moving at less than 30 km/h). Overtaking is allowed without crossing into the oncoming traffic lane for a motorcycle without a sidecar, a moped, and a bicycle.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the blue light vehicle.
Both the bus driver and the driver of the blue car.

question: Does a light vehicle driver violate traffic rules when moving in the direction of an arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a.g" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of the "Traffic Regulations" of Georgia, overtaking is prohibited at an intersection that is not a circular junction or directly in front of this intersection, except in cases where overtaking is carried out without leaving the lane for oncoming traffic at a regulated intersection. Furthermore, according to paragraph 2 of Article 36 of the same law, an intersection where the order of traffic is determined by signals from a traffic light or a traffic controller is a regulated intersection.

question: The driver of the vehicle who is permitted to enter pedestrian areas in cases established by road traffic rules must:
explanation: According to paragraph 5 of article 25 of the "Law of Georgia on Road Traffic," a driver of a vehicle who is allowed to enter pedestrian areas in the cases specified by this law must exercise maximum caution and drive at a low speed so as to be able to stop if necessary.

answers.answer: Give a sound signal and move at no more than 50 km/h speed.
Turn on the close-range lights and give a sound signal to attract the attention of pedestrians.
Exercise maximum caution and drive at a low speed so that you can stop if necessary.

question: Which driver of a vehicle violates the traffic rules if they are driving at a speed of 90 km/h?
explanation: According to paragraph "a" and sub-paragraph "b.a" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the "Road Traffic" legislation of Georgia, except for the cases established by this law, on the section of the road between uninhabited and inhabited areas where movement is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h according to the relevant road sign, the following is permitted: a) Movement of vehicles of category "A", as well as subcategories "A1" and "B1" on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h; b) Movement of vehicles of category "B": b.a) if it is not towing a light trailer, on the highway at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h, and on other roads – not exceeding 90 km/h.

answers.answer: Only the driver of a light vehicle.
Only quad bike and motorcycle drivers.

question: Is it prohibited for a motorcycle rider to overtake in the direction of an arrow if they need to travel at a minimum speed of 85 km/h to overtake a light vehicle?
explanation: According to paragraph "a" of point 7 of article 33 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, in the section of the road between an uninhabited point and an inhabited point where movement is permitted at a speed exceeding 60 km/h according to the appropriate road sign, the following is allowed: a) Movement of vehicles of category "A," as well as subcategories "A1" and "B1," on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h.

question: Is it prohibited for a motorcycle rider to overtake in the direction of the arrow if visibility is limited on that section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by entering the opposite traffic lane, in consideration of the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article. According to paragraph 1.12.2 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 1.12.2, "Dangerous Turn," indicates dangerous turns on a road with a small radius or limited visibility - to the left.

question: Is it prohibited for a driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow if visibility is limited on the given section of the road?
explanation: According to paragraph "e" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by crossing into the opposite traffic lane, taking into account the requirements set out in paragraph 3 of this article. According to point 1.1 of the first section of the second annex of this law (horizontal markings), horizontal marking 1.1 separates the flows of vehicles moving in the opposite direction and indicates the boundary of the traffic lane or the boundary of the roadway at a hazardous section of the road, where entry is prohibited; it indicates the boundary of the parking space for vehicles and the edge of the roadway that does not belong to the highway under movement conditions. Crossing the 1.1 line is prohibited. Crossing the 1.1 line, which indicates the edge of the roadway and is located on the driver's right side, is allowed for the purpose of parking the vehicle on the roadside.

question: Is it prohibited for a driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of an arrow if visibility is limited on the given section of the road?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," overtaking is prohibited under conditions of limited visibility by entering the opposite lane, considering the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article. According to paragraph 1.12.1 of the first annex of this law, road sign 1.12.1, "Dangerous Turn," indicates dangerous turns to the right on roads with a small radius or limited visibility. According to paragraph 1.5 of the first section (Horizontal Markings) of the second annex of this law, horizontal marking 1.5 separates flows of vehicles moving in opposite directions on roads with two or three lanes; it indicates the boundary of the traffic lane when there are two or more lanes intended for movement in one direction. Crossing line 1.5 is allowed from any side.

question: In the given situation, which vehicle driver is prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow if the motorcycle is already bypassing an obstacle?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 3 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, before starting to overtake, the driver must ensure, without violating the requirements established in paragraph 2 of Article 20 and Article 32 of this law, that the driver of the vehicle moving in the same lane in front of them has not signaled their intention to overtake another vehicle. Overtaking is prohibited for vehicles that are in the process of overtaking or circumventing an obstacle. According to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 9 of this article, overtaking is prohibited for vehicles that are engaged in overtaking or circumventing, in consideration of the requirements established in paragraph 3 of this article. According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 6 of Article 45 of the same law, towing with a motorcycle without a sidecar, as well as towing such a motorcycle, is prohibited.

answers.answer: Only for book riders and book riders motorcycle drivers.
Only the driver of a light vehicle.
As for the riders of motorcycles and those riding bicycles, as well as the driver of a light vehicle.

question: Which driver's obligation is to yield when traveling in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the second paragraph of Article 35 of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," on mountain roads and other roads with similar characteristics that have steep slopes, as well as on roads marked by road signs 1.14 and 1.15, where it is impossible or difficult to yield to the side, the driver of a vehicle moving downhill is obliged to stop and yield the road to the driver of a vehicle moving uphill, except in cases where the place to turn is located alongside the roadway in such a way that the driver of the vehicle moving uphill could stop at the turn ahead, considering the speed and condition of the vehicle, thereby eliminating the necessity for one of the vehicles to reverse. According to paragraph 1.15 of the first chapter (warning signs) of the first annex of this law, road sign 1.15 "Steep Ascent" provides a warning about approaching a section of road with a steep ascent.

answers.answer: the driver of a light vehicle

question: In the given situation, only the driver of the yellow shuttle bus is handling the boarding and alighting of passengers. Which driver's vehicle does not violate the stopping rules?
explanation: According to paragraph "a.a" of point 6 of article 37 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited to stop a vehicle on the roadway on pedestrian and cyclist crossings and within 5 meters in front of them. Furthermore, according to paragraph 3 of article 41 of the same law, on a road where there are road signs 5.11, 5.13.1, 5.13.2, and 5.14 designating lanes for the movement of public transport vehicles, it is prohibited for other vehicles to move or stop in these lanes. If this lane is marked with a broken line separating it from the rest of the roadway, other vehicles must merge into this lane while turning. It is also permitted to enter this lane in certain places when exiting the road and during passenger boarding or alighting at the right edge of the roadway, provided this does not obstruct the movement of public transport vehicles. According to point 5.14 of the first annex of the same law, road sign 5.14 "Lane for Public Transport Vehicles" indicates a road on which public transport vehicles operate in a specially designated lane in the same direction as the general flow of vehicles. The effect of the sign applies to the lane in which it is placed. The effect of a sign placed on the right side of the road extends to the farthest right lane of the roadway.

answers.answer: Only the driver of a light vehicle.
Only the driver of the yellow minibus.
Not a single driver of a car

question: If a public transport vehicle stops or slows down in front of an unregulated pedestrian crossing, drivers of other vehicles in adjacent lanes must continue driving.
explanation: According to paragraph 9 of article 25 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations", if a scheduled transport vehicle stops or reduces speed in front of an unregulated pedestrian crossing, the drivers of other vehicles moving in adjacent lanes must continue their movement only after ensuring that there is no pedestrian in front of the stopped scheduled transport vehicle.

answers.answer: Without changing speed, as a pedestrian is obliged not to step out in front of a stationary vehicle until they ensure that no approaching vehicle is present.
Only after they are assured that there are no pedestrians in front of the stopped public transport vehicle.

question: When driving on the road, the driver must consider that overtaking often creates the most hazardous situations.
explanation: According to subparagraph "m" of paragraph 10 of article 25 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," a driver must consider the following circumstances while driving on the road: m) an emergency situation often arises during overtaking due to a lack of distance and insufficient attention to vehicles moving in the opposite direction.

answers.answer: Only due to the vulnerability of distance.
Due to insufficient attention to vehicles moving in the opposite direction
Due to the lack of attention to both the vulnerability of the distance and to vehicles moving in the opposite direction.

question: Does a light vehicle driver have the right to stop at the location indicated by the arrow for the purpose of picking up passengers?
explanation: According to paragraph 3 of article 41 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," on a road where there are traffic signs 5.11, 5.13.1, 5.13.2, and 5.14 indicating a lane designated for the movement of scheduled transport vehicles, the movement and stopping of other vehicles in this lane is prohibited. If this lane is separated from the rest of the roadway by a broken line, other vehicles must merge into this lane when turning. question: When transferring children's groups, the group should be divided into lines, with no more than in a line:
explanation: According to paragraph 5 of Article 26 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, groups of children must be accompanied by an adult guardian, and the group of children must be divided into lines, with no more than two children in each line.

question: Is it mandatory to use a special child seat, chair, or restraint device when transporting a child under 3 years old in the back seat of a car, except when the passenger sitting in the back seat is at least 16 years old and is holding only this child in their lap?
explanation: According to Article 26, paragraphs 7 and 8 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic: 7. question: The driver involved in a road-transport accident is obliged to:

question: In the case of the forced stopping of a vehicle at the location indicated in the picture, the driver must:

answers.answer: It only needs to activate the emergency lights.
The vehicle should be marked with the appropriate sign at a sufficient distance.
The emergency lights should be activated, and the vehicle should be marked with the appropriate sign at a sufficient distance.

question: Which vehicle is parked in violation of parking regulations?

question: Does the driver of a light vehicle have the right to stop at the location indicated in the picture for the purpose of picking up passengers?

question: Does the driver of a freight vehicle have the right to stop in the area indicated by the arrow if the given road has one lane in each direction?
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of the second point of Article 37 of the Law of Georgia on “Road Traffic,” a vehicle that stops or stands on the roadway must be as close as possible to the edge of the roadway. question: If the requirements of road signs and road markings contradict each other, the driver is obligated to follow:

question: If the middle lane of a two-way road with three lanes is used for movement in both directions, it is considered to be on the side of the oncoming traffic.
explanation: According to paragraph 3 of article 31 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, on a two-way road with three traffic lanes marked by road signs, the lane on the right side is considered to be the side of traffic in the same direction, unless otherwise established by means of traffic organization.

answers.answer: Only the lane for movement located on the right side.

question: Did the driver of the white car violate traffic rules by stopping at the location indicated in the picture?

question: Does the driver of the light vehicle have the right to park the car in the parking space indicated in the picture from 19:00 to 21:00 on even days of the month?
explanation: According to paragraphs 3.29 and 3.30 of the first annex of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the road sign 3.29 "Stopping is prohibited on odd days" prohibits stopping of vehicles on odd days of the month, while the road sign 3.30 "Stopping is prohibited on even days" prohibits stopping of vehicles on even days of the month. According to the notes of these paragraphs 3.29 and 3.30, when both signs are used simultaneously, the time for moving a vehicle from one side of the road to the other is from 19:00 to 21:00, during which stopping is permitted on both sides of the roadway.

question: What is the maximum speed that a driver of a two-wheeled electric scooter is allowed to travel in a populated or unpopulated area?
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 8 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", unless otherwise specified by this law, the movement of two-wheeled electric scooters is permitted on all roads where the movement of vehicles of this category is allowed in populated or unpopulated areas, with a speed of no more than 20 km/h.

question: Is it possible for the hand signal given by the driver regarding the intent to perform a maneuver to be discontinued immediately before the start of the maneuver in the absence of the turning signal or if it is out of order?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, before starting a maneuver, the driver is obliged to activate the corresponding turn signal, and if it is not functioning or is out of order, to signal manually. The signal for turning left or reversing corresponds to the left arm extended horizontally to the side or the right arm bent upward at a right angle at the elbow while extended to the side. The signal for turning right corresponds to the right arm extended horizontally to the side or the left arm bent upward at a right angle at the elbow while extended to the side. The signal for braking corresponds to the left or right hand raised vertically upward. The signal must be given in a timely manner, before the start of the maneuver, and must be stopped immediately after the maneuver is completed (hand signaling can be ceased just before starting the maneuver). Furthermore, the signal must not confuse other road users. Signaling with a turn indicator or manually does not grant the driver priority and does not exempt from the obligation to take necessary precautions.

question: A means of transport is considered to be stopped involuntarily if:
explanation: According to paragraph 26 of article 5 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," forced stopping is the cessation of the movement of a vehicle due to the technical malfunction of the vehicle, the cargo to be transported, the condition of the driver (passenger), or a hazard caused by an unexpectedly created obstacle on the road.

answers.answer: The movement is suspended due to technical malfunction.
The movement is intentionally suspended for more than 5 minutes, unless it pertains to passenger boarding or alighting, or loading and unloading of the vehicle.
The movement has been intentionally suspended for up to 5 minutes.

question: A vehicle is considered to be parked if:

answers.answer: The movement is deliberately interrupted for more than 5 minutes unless it is necessary for passenger boarding and alighting or for loading and unloading the vehicle.

Operation is suspended due to technical malfunction.

Towards both the motorcycle and the white car driver.

question: In the case of movement in that direction, it has an advantage:

question: In the given situation, when vehicles simultaneously change lanes, the right of way is granted to:

In cases where vehicles traveling in the same direction change lanes simultaneously and their trajectories intersect, the driver of the vehicle on the right shall have the right of way.
