question: Does the truck driver have the right to continue moving in the direction of the arrow if the width of the roadway is insufficient for turning from the left lane?
explanation: According to paragraph 10 of Article 32 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, if the width of the road is insufficient for maneuvering from the extreme left position when turning beyond an intersection, the maneuver may be performed from the right edge of the roadway or from the right side, with the driver required to yield to vehicles moving in the same or opposite direction. According to point 1.11 of Annex 2 of the same law, horizontal road markings 1.11 separate vehicle flows moving in opposite or same directions on a section of the road where merging is allowed from only one lane; they indicate the turning points, exits, and entrances from parking areas, etc., where movement is permitted only on one side. Crossing the 1.11 line is allowed from the side of a broken line, as well as from the side of a solid line, but only upon completing an overtaking or bypassing maneuver.

question: If the width of the roadway is insufficient for a heavy vehicle to turn from the left lane, while moving in the direction of the arrow, the driver of the heavy vehicle is obliged to yield the way:
explanation: According to paragraphs 10 and 11 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic": 10. If the width of the roadway is insufficient to make a turn from the extreme left position beyond the intersection, this maneuver may be performed from the right edge of the roadway or from the right side. In addition, the driver must yield to vehicles moving in the same and opposite directions. 11. If the width of the roadway at the intersection is insufficient to make a turn from the extreme left position, the driver is required to perform this maneuver beyond the intersection, unless the width of the road near the intersection does not allow this. In all cases, the safety of traffic must be ensured, and no obstacles should be created for other road users. The rule defined in this paragraph does not apply to intersections where turning is prohibited by appropriate road signs or markings.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the white light vehicle.
Only the driver of the black light car.
The driver of all three vehicles

question: Does the truck driver have the right to continue moving in the direction of the arrow if the width of the roadway is insufficient for turning from the left lane?
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of point 7 and point 8 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic: 7. Before turning right or left to exit onto another road or to enter an area adjacent to the road, in such a way that it does not violate the requirements set forth in paragraph 2 of Article 20 of this law, as well as the first and second points of this article, if the driver of the vehicle intends to exit the road: b) from the left side, the vehicle should approach, as much as possible, the centerline of the roadway (on a two-way street) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way street), and if it intends to exit onto another two-way street, the turn should be performed in such a way that upon exiting, the vehicle does not end up on the side of opposing traffic. 8. If the driver cannot make a turn due to the vehicle's dimensions or other reasons, a deviation from these rules is permissible, taking into account the requirements established in point 7 of this article, as long as traffic safety is ensured and other road users are not obstructed.

answers.answer: It is allowed, provided that the safety of the movement is ensured and it does not create obstacles for other road traffic participants.

question: The width of the roadway is insufficient for turning from the left lane; which vehicle has priority in the case of a truck driver's movement in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subsection "b" of paragraph 7 and paragraph 8 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic": 7. To turn right or left before exiting onto another road or entering an adjacent area, without violating the requirements established by paragraph 2 of Article 20 of this law and the first and second paragraphs of this article, if the driver of the vehicle intends to exit the road: b) from the left side, the vehicle should approach the center of the roadway (on a two-way road) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way road) as much as possible, and if the driver intends to exit onto another two-way road, the turn should be executed in such a way that the vehicle does not end up on the side of the opposing traffic upon leaving the intersecting road. 8. If the driver cannot make the turn due to the size of the vehicle or other reasons, it is permissible to deviate from these rules, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 7 of this article, provided that traffic safety is ensured and no obstacles are created for other road traffic participants.

answers.answer: Only towards the white light vehicle.
Only regarding the blue light car.

question: Near the intersection, the width of the road does not allow for turning. Does the truck driver's permission to continue moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," if the width of the roadway at an intersection is insufficient for making a U-turn from the extreme left position, the driver is obliged to perform this maneuver beyond the intersection, except in cases where the width of the road near the intersection does not allow for this. In all cases, the safety of traffic must be ensured, and no obstruction should be caused to other road users. The rule specified in this paragraph does not apply to intersections where U-turns are prohibited by the relevant road sign or marking. According to point 3.19 of the third chapter (Prohibitory Signs) of the first annex of this law, the road sign 3.19 "U-turn prohibited" forbids making a U-turn at the nearest intersection of roadways.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to move to exit the road:
explanation: According to paragraph 13 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," in the presence of a deceleration lane, a driver intending to turn must timely move into this lane and then reduce speed.

answers.answer: Only in the direction of A.
Both in direction A and in direction B.

question: If there is a running lane at the exit point on the road, the driver of a light vehicle is allowed to move:
explanation: According to paragraph 14 of article 32 of the "Traffic Regulations" law of Georgia, if there is an acceleration lane at the exit point on the road, the driver must move in this lane and yield to vehicles traveling in the adjacent traffic lane when changing lanes.

answers.answer: Only in the direction of A.
Both in the direction of A and B.

question: Does a light vehicle driver have the right to continue moving in the direction of the arrow if the tractor is moving at a speed of 25 km/h?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 17 of article 32 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," considering the requirements established by this article, a driver may pass on the right or left side of a safety island, pump, or other device located on the carriageway where they are moving, except when the safety island, pump, or other device is positioned on the centerline of a two-way traffic road. In this case, the driver must pass the safety island, pump, or other device only on the right side.

question: A light vehicle driver is allowed to move:
explanation: According to subparagraph “a” of paragraph 17 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on “Road Traffic,” taking into account the requirements established by this article, a driver may overtake a safety island, a pump, or other device on the roadway from the right or left, except in cases where a traffic sign indicates from which side the driver must overtake the safety island, pump, or other device. According to paragraph 4.2.3 of the fourth chapter (Guiding Signs) of the first annex of this law, traffic sign 4.2.3 "Overtaking obstacle from the right or left" indicates the direction for overtaking an obstacle from the right or left.

answers.answer: In both direction A and B.

question: Is it prohibited for a driver to turn the vehicle in the direction of an arrow if the visibility is limited to up to 90 meters?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 15 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited to turn a vehicle on a road where visibility is less than 100 meters in at least one direction.

question: Which driver's violation of traffic rules occurs if they stop at the indicated spot with an arrow on the bridge to let passengers board?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b.a" of paragraph 6 of article 37 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", it is prohibited to stop vehicles in any place where it can create a hazard, including on overpasses, bridges, and roadways, except in cases where there are more than two lanes of concurrent traffic in those areas.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the white car.
Only the driver of the green car.

question: In the given situation, which driver's vehicle is violating the traffic rules if a light vehicle is moving in reverse in the direction of the arrow to pick up passengers on the bridge, while a motorcycle is turning in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to Subparagraph "g" of Paragraph 15 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", it is prohibited to turn a vehicle on a bridge, a viaduct, and underneath them. According to Paragraph 16 of the same article, a driver who intends to turn or move in reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without posing a danger or obstructing other road users. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. It is prohibited to move in reverse at intersections, on highways, and in the locations defined by Paragraph 15 of this article.

question: In the given situation, turning the vehicle is allowed:
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 15 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," it is prohibited to turn a vehicle on a bridge, overpass, or under them. According to paragraph 1.5 of the first part of Annex 2 of the same law (horizontal markings), horizontal markings 1.5 separate vehicle flows moving in opposite directions on a road that has two or three lanes; it indicates the boundaries of traffic lanes when there are two or more lanes designated for movement in one direction. Crossing the 1.5 line is allowed from any side.

answers.answer: Both in direction A and direction B
It is not allowed in both directions.

question: In this situation, the driver of the vehicle that has missed the turn, in order to enter the right turn:
explanation: According to paragraph 16 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," a driver intending to turn or move in reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating a danger or interfering with other road users. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. Moving in reverse is prohibited at intersections, on highways, and in the locations defined in paragraph 15 of this article. According to paragraph 4.1.4 of section 4 (directional signs) of the first annex of this law, road sign 4.1.4 "movement straight or to the right" allows movement only in the directions indicated by the arrows.

answers.answer: They have the right to turn the car in direction A.
Has the right to move backward in direction B.
Has the right to move in both direction A and direction B.
Movement is prohibited in both direction A and direction B.

question: In the given situation, turning the car around is allowed.
explanation: According to paragraph 15, subparagraphs "a" and "v" of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited to turn a vehicle: a) at a pedestrian crossing; v) in a place where there is a stopping point. According to paragraph 5.16 of section 5 (Special Instruction Signs) of the first annex of this law, road sign 5.16 "Bus and (or) Trolleybus Stop" indicates the stopping place for the corresponding type of public transport. According to sections 5.19.1 and 5.19.2 of the same chapter, road signs 5.19.1 and 5.19.2 "Pedestrian Crossing" indicate the area designated for pedestrian crossing on the road. Sign 5.19.1 is installed on the right side of the road, while sign 5.19.2 is installed on the left side. In the absence of marking for crossing 1.14, sign 5.19.1 is installed near the close boundary of the crossing, while sign 5.19.2 is installed near the far boundary of the crossing.

answers.answer: In both the A and B directions.
It is not allowed in either direction.

question: Which driver of a vehicle is prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 8 of Article 29 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," at railway crossings, near retractable bridges, at the landing of ships or barges, at exits for fire trucks from the road, and at locations where the trajectory of flying objects crosses the road at a low height, two alternating flashing red or yellow light signals are used, arranged at one station, at the same height, directed to one side. The red light signal prohibits crossing the "STOP" line; in its absence, it prohibits proceeding beyond the traffic light. The yellow light signal means that drivers may continue to move but are obliged to exercise special caution. If the colored light signals are off, movement is only permitted when no train (locomotive, railcar) is visible within sight range approaching the crossing. Additionally, according to sub-point "d" of paragraph 15 of Article 32 of the same law, turning a vehicle at a railway crossing is prohibited.

answers.answer: Only the driver of a light vehicle.
Not a single driver of a car.

question: Is the driver of the red car prohibited from reversing in the direction of the arrow to enter the turn?
explanation: According to paragraph "g.b" of the first point of article 38 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, drivers are prohibited from making U-turns or reversing on highways, at the entrances and exits of highways, as well as from entering the central reservation and crossing the lanes of the road in a transverse manner. According to point 5.1 of chapter 5 (Special Instruction Signs) of the first annex of the same law, the road sign 5.1 "Highway" indicates a highway where the regulations governing movement on highways apply.

question: Is the driver of the light vehicle prohibited from reversing in the direction of the arrow after passing the transverse connection point of the roadway?
explanation: According to paragraph "g.b" of the first section of article 38 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, drivers are prohibited from making a U-turn or reversing on highways, at highway entrances and exits, as well as from exiting the central divider and from both lanes of the road. According to paragraph 5.1 of Chapter 5 (Signs of Special Instructions) of the first annex of the same law, the road sign 5.1 "Highway" indicates a highway where the requirements of regulations governing traffic on highways apply.

question: What is the maximum speed limit for the driver of an oversized (large-sized) or heavy (heavy-weight) vehicle in a populated or unpopulated area?
explanation: According to sub-paragraph "e" of paragraph 8 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise stipulated by this law, in residential or non-residential areas, the movement of non-gabaritic (oversized) or heavy-duty (weighty) vehicles is permitted at a speed not exceeding that specified in the agreement issued by the authorized body (agency) in accordance with the procedure established by Georgian legislation.

answers.answer: Not exceeding the speed specified in the agreement issued by the authorized body (agency) in accordance with the procedure established by Georgian legislation.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a mechanical transport vehicle carrying hazardous cargo in a populated or unpopulated area?
explanation: According to subparagraph "v" of paragraph 8 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," unless otherwise determined by this law, in populated or unpopulated areas, the movement of a mechanical vehicle transporting hazardous goods is permitted at a speed not exceeding that specified by the conditions of transportation.

answers.answer: at a speed defined by the terms of transportation, not exceeding

question: In addition to the maximum speed limit set by law, the driver is prohibited from exceeding:
explanation: According to paragraph "a", "b", and "c" of point 9 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," in addition to the maximum speed limitations specified in paragraphs 6-8 of this article, the driver is prohibited from: a) exceeding the maximum design speed established for the vehicle; b) exceeding the speed indicated on the information sign "Speed Limit" affixed to the vehicle; c) exceeding the maximum speed established by the road sign.

answers.answer: Only the maximum design speed set for the means of transport.
The speed indicated on the traffic sign "Speed Limit" attached to the vehicle.
Only the maximum speed determined by traffic signs
As established for the maximum design speed for vehicles, as well as the maximum speed indicated on the "Speed Limit" sign affixed to the vehicle and set by road signs.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to move:
explanation: According to paragraph 7 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before turning right or left to exit onto another road or to enter the area adjacent to the road, in such a manner that does not violate the requirements established by paragraph 2 of Article 20 of this law and the first and second paragraphs of this article, if the driver of the vehicle intends to exit the road: a) from the right side, the vehicle must move as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway and then make a maneuver as briefly as possible; b) from the left side, the vehicle must, as much as possible, approach the centerline of the roadway (on a two-way road) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way road), and if it intends to exit onto another two-way road, the turn should be made in such a way that when exiting from crossing the roadway, the vehicle does not end up in the opposite direction of traffic. According to paragraph 1.1 of the first section (Horizontal Marking) of Annex 2 of this law, horizontal marking 1.1 separates the transport flows moving in opposite directions and designates the boundaries of traffic lanes or the boundaries of the roadway on hazardous sections of the road, where entry is prohibited; crossing the 1.1 line is prohibited. Crossing the line indicating the edge of the roadway and the 1.1 line located on the driver's right side is allowed for the vehicle to halt on the roadside.

answers.answer: Only straight ahead and to the right.
Only forward, to the left, and in reverse direction (turning).

question: The driver of a light vehicle has the right to move:
explanation: According to paragraph 7 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic", before turning right or left to exit onto another road or to enter the adjacent area, in such a way as not to violate the requirements established by paragraph 2 of article 20 of this law and the first and second paragraphs of this article, if the driver of the vehicle intends to leave the road: a) from the right side, the vehicle must move as close as possible to the right edge of the roadway and then perform the maneuver as briefly as possible; b) from the left side, the vehicle must approach, as much as possible, the center of the roadway (on a two-way road) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way road), and if it intends to exit onto another two-way road, the turn must be performed in such a way that upon exiting the crossing of the roadways, the vehicle does not end up on the side of oncoming traffic. According to paragraph 1.1 of the first subsection of the second annex of this law (horizontal marking), the horizontal marking 1.1 separates the streams of vehicles moving in opposite directions and marks the boundaries of traffic lanes or the boundaries of the roadway at a hazardous section of the road, where entry is prohibited; crossing the 1.1 line is prohibited. Crossing the line indicating the edge of the roadway and located on the driver's right side, 1.1, is permitted for the vehicle to stop at the edge of the road.

answers.answer: Only straight and to the right.

question: Is the driver of the car prohibited from reversing in the direction of the arrow to enter the turn?
explanation: According to paragraph 16 of article 32 of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," a driver intending to make a U-turn or to reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating a hazard or interfering with other road users. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. It is prohibited to reverse at intersections, on motorways, and in the places specified in paragraph 15 of this article.

question: In the middle of a two-way road's carriageway, at the same level as the tram tracks, the side separating opposing traffic directions is considered:
explanation: According to paragraph 3 of article 31 of the Georgian law on "Road Traffic," on a two-way street, when the tram tracks are located at the same level in the middle of the roadway, the imaginary median line between the tram tracks moving in opposite directions is considered the dividing line for the opposite movement sides.

answers.answer: Imaginary middle line between opposing tram tracks
The right track of the tram moving in the adjacent direction.
The left track of the tram moving in the opposite direction.

question: Does the driver of a freight vehicle have the right to move in the direction of the arrow if the central lane of the given two-way street is used for movement in both directions?
explanation: According to paragraph 7 of article 31 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, a driver of a vehicle on a two-way road with three traffic lanes (except for road marking 1.9) must not move to the edge lane of the roadway where traffic in the opposite direction is carried out. If the middle lane on a three-lane road is used for traffic in both directions, it is allowed to exit this lane only for the purpose of overtaking, avoiding an obstacle, turning left, or making a U-turn.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to move:
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 7 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before turning right or left to exit another road or to enter an adjacent area, so as not to violate the requirements established by paragraph 2 of article 20 of this law, and by paragraphs 1 and 2 of this article, if the driver of a vehicle intends to exit from the left side of the road, the vehicle must, as much as possible, approach the centerline of the roadway (on a two-way road) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way road); and if the driver intends to exit onto another two-way road, the turn must be executed in such a way that upon exiting the intersection of roadways, the vehicle does not end up on the side of opposite traffic.

answers.answer: Both in direction A and direction B

question: The driver of a light vehicle has the right to move:
explanation: According to paragraph 17 of Article 31 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," when entering a lane with reverse movement, the driver of the vehicle must drive in such a way that upon exiting the roadway, they occupy the right lateral lane of movement. Switching to another lane is only permitted after the driver ensures that concurrent movement is allowed in that specific lane. Furthermore, according to paragraph 5.10 of Chapter 5 (Special Instruction Signs) of the first annex of this law, the traffic sign 5.10 "Exit onto a road with reverse movement" indicates the exit from the section of road marked with sign 5.8 "Reverse Movement." The sign must be placed in front of all side exits. The sign may not be placed at the intersection with the road leading out of the adjacent area if access to that area is possible only from the road marked with sign 5.8 "Reverse Movement."

question: How many lanes does the given road have?
explanation: According to paragraph 15 of article 5 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," the roadway is an element of the road intended for the movement of wheelless vehicles (excluding sidewalks, curbs, bike paths, and pedestrian paths). According to paragraph 12 of the same article, a road is the entire surface of a road or street open for traffic. A road can have either one roadway or several roadways sharply divided by a separating lane or existing at different levels. This term may also include tram tracks, sidewalks, curb lanes, medians, and bike paths.

question: How many lanes does the given road have?
explanation: According to paragraph 15 of article 5 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, the roadway (travelway) is a part of the road designed for the movement of motor vehicles (excluding sidewalks, shoulders, bike lanes, and pedestrian paths). According to paragraph 12 of the same article, a road is the entire surface of a road or street open for traffic. A road may have one travelway or several travelways that are sharply separated by a lane or exist at different levels. This term may also include tram tracks, sidewalks, shoulders, dividing strips, and bike lanes.

question: Is it prohibited to enter a tram line moving in the opposite direction with a vehicle without a license?
explanation: According to paragraph 15 of article 31 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 6 of article 32 of this law, movement is permitted on the tram tracks of the opposing direction, which are located at the same level as the roadway on the left side, if all lanes designated for movement in the opposing direction are occupied, as well as during maneuvers to bypass an obstacle, overtaking, turning left, or making a U-turn. Furthermore, tram movements should not cause any obstruction. Exiting onto the tram tracks of the opposite direction is prohibited.

answers.answer: It is not prohibited if all lanes are occupied for movement in the same direction.

question: Under what circumstances is it allowed to operate a non-rail transport vehicle on the left side of the road, at the same level as the tram tracks of the same direction?
explanation: According to paragraph 15 of article 31 of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, and in consideration of the requirements established by paragraph 6 of article 32 of this law, movement is permitted on the tram tracks in the same direction that are at the same level with the roadway on the left side, if all lanes intended for movement in the same direction are occupied, as well as during overtaking, maneuvering around an obstacle, or turning left or making a U-turn. Additionally, tram movement must not be obstructed. It is prohibited to enter the tram tracks in the opposite direction.

answers.answer: Only in the case where all lanes are occupied for movement in the same direction.
Only in the case of overcoming an obstacle or overtaking.
Only in the case of turning or rotating to the left.
In any case listed in this ticket, provided that it does not obstruct the tram's movement.

question: Where is it prohibited to turn a vehicle as listed below?
explanation: According to paragraph "e" and subparagraphs "v" of paragraph 15 of article 32 of the Georgian law on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited to turn a vehicle: e) on a road where visibility is less than 100 meters in at least one direction; v) at a location where there is a stopping point. According to subparagraph "g.b" of paragraph 1 of article 38 of the same law, drivers are prohibited from turning or moving in reverse on highways, at the entrances and exits of highways, as well as from entering the central divider and transverse junctions of both lanes of the road.

answers.answer: Only on the road where visibility is less than 100 meters in any direction.
Only in the place where there is a stop point.
In any of the places listed on this ticket.

question: When vehicles moving in opposite directions simultaneously change lanes and their trajectories intersect, priority is given to:
explanation: According to paragraph 4 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, when changing lanes without altering the direction of movement, the driver must yield to the vehicle moving in the same direction in the crossing lane. In the case of simultaneous lane changes by vehicles moving in the same direction, priority is given to the driver of the vehicle on the right when the trajectories of the movements intersect.

answers.answer: the driver of the vehicle on the right
the driver of the vehicle on the left

question: If the trajectories of vehicles intersect and the order of passage is not determined, the driver must yield to the vehicle approaching them.
explanation: According to paragraph 12 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," if the trajectories of vehicle movements intersect and the order of passing is not defined, the driver must yield to the vehicle that approaches from the right.

question: Which of the places listed below is prohibited from reverse movement of vehicles?
explanation: According to paragraph 15(b) and paragraph 16 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic: 15. "b" It is prohibited to turn a vehicle around in a tunnel; 16. A driver intending to turn around or reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating a danger or obstructing other road users. Assistance from another person is advisable if necessary. Reversing is prohibited at intersections, on highways, and in places defined by paragraph 15 of this article.

answers.answer: In any place listed on this ticket

question: The driver who intends to move in reverse must ensure that:
explanation: According to paragraph 16 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, a driver intending to make a turn or reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating any danger or obstruction to other road users. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. It is prohibited to reverse on intersections, highways, and in the places specified in paragraph 15 of this article.

answers.answer: He can perform this maneuver in such a way that it does not create a hazard and does not interfere with other participants in traffic.
He is given the right of way, and other participants in the road traffic yield to him.

question: Does the driver have the right to receive assistance from another person while reversing a vehicle?
explanation: According to paragraph 16 of article 32 of the Law on Road Traffic of Georgia, a driver intending to turn or reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating danger or hindrance to other road users. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. Reversing is prohibited at intersections, on highways, and in the locations specified in paragraph 15 of this article.

question: If a safety island, pump, or device is located on the axis of the roadway of a two-way road, the driver must go around it.
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 17 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," considering the requirements established by this article, a driver may maneuver around a safety island, pump, or other device placed on the roadway from the right or left side, except in cases where the safety island, pump, or other device is located on the centerline of a two-way road's travel lane. In this case, the driver must only maneuver around the safety island, pump, or other device from the right side.

answers.answer: From the right or the left side.

question: In the case of the presence of a braking line, the driver who intends to turn is obligated to:
explanation: According to paragraph 13 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, if there is a braking lane, the driver intending to make a turn must timely move into this lane and then reduce their speed.

answers.answer: Slow down in advance and perform the turning maneuver without crossing the braking zone.
Move smoothly onto the braking strip and then reduce speed.
Stop on the braking line before performing the turning maneuver.

question: Is the driver of a light vehicle required to activate the right turn signal when moving in the direction of the right-turn indicator, if no vehicle is moving behind them?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before starting a maneuver, the driver is obliged to activate the relevant direction indicator, and if it is not functioning or is out of order, to signal with their hand.

question: Is a driver of a light vehicle required to turn on the left turn signal when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, before starting a maneuver, the driver is required to activate the corresponding direction indicator, and if it is not functioning or is out of order, to signal manually.

question: Which painting shows the left turn signal given by a motorcycle rider with their hand?
explanation: According to Article 32, Paragraph 2 of the Law of Georgia on Traffic, before starting a maneuver, the driver is obligated to activate the appropriate turning signal, or if it is not functioning or has broken down, to signal manually. A left turn or U-turn signal corresponds to the left hand extended horizontally to the side or the right hand bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. A right turn signal corresponds to the right hand extended horizontally to the side or the left hand bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. The brake signal corresponds to the left or right hand raised vertically upwards.

question: Which picture shows the right turn signal given by a motorcycle rider using their hand?
explanation: According to Article 32, paragraph 2 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," before starting a maneuver, the driver is required to activate the turn signal in the appropriate direction, or if it is not available or malfunctioning, to signal manually. The signal for turning or making a U-turn to the left corresponds to extending the left arm horizontally or a right arm bent at the elbow in an upward position at a right angle. The signal for turning to the right corresponds to extending the right arm horizontally or a left arm bent at the elbow in an upward position at a right angle. The signal for braking corresponds to raising the left or right arm vertically upwards.

question: Which painting shows the hand signal for braking given by a motorcycle rider?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," before starting a maneuver, the driver is required to activate the appropriate direction turning signal, or if it is not available or out of order, to signal manually. The signal for turning left or making a U-turn corresponds to the left arm extended horizontally or the right arm bent upward at a right angle at the elbow. The signal for turning right corresponds to the right arm extended horizontally or the left arm bent upward at a right angle at the elbow. The signal for braking corresponds to the left or right arm raised vertically upward.

question: Which painting shows the hand signal for braking given by a car driver?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, before starting a maneuver, the driver is required to activate the corresponding direction turning signal; if it is not functioning or is out of order, they must signal manually. The signal for a left turn or a U-turn corresponds to the left hand extended horizontally to the side or the right hand extended to the side, bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. The signal for a right turn corresponds to the right hand extended horizontally to the side or the left hand extended to the side, bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. The signal for braking corresponds to the left or right hand raised vertically upward.

question: Which painting shows a driver signaling a right turn by hand?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 32 of the Georgian Law on Road Traffic, before starting a maneuver, the driver is obligated to activate the corresponding direction indicator, and if it is not present or is out of order, to signal manually. A left turn or U-turn signal is indicated by the left arm extended horizontally to the side or the right arm bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. A right turn signal is indicated by the right arm extended horizontally to the side or the left arm bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow. A braking signal is indicated by either the left or right arm raised vertically upwards.

question: Which painting shows the hand signal for a left turn or turn given by a car driver?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 32 of the Georgian law on "Road Traffic," before starting a maneuver, the driver is obliged to turn on the appropriate direction indicator, or if it is not working or has malfunctioned, to signal manually. A left turn or turn signal corresponds to the left arm extended horizontally to the side or the right arm bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow, extended to the side. A right turn signal corresponds to the right arm extended horizontally to the side or the left arm bent upwards at a right angle at the elbow, extended to the side. A braking signal corresponds to the left or right arm raised vertically upwards.

question: The signal given to the driver about the intention to perform a maneuver can be indicated by turn signals or manually.
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, signaling with a turn signal or hand does not give the driver any advantage and does not exempt them from the obligation to take necessary precautions.

answers.answer: releases from the necessity of taking precautionary measures
It does not give preference, nor does it exempt from the need to take necessary precautions.

question: The driver should signal the intention to maneuver with the appropriate turn signals.
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 32 of the Georgian Law on Road Traffic, the turn signal must be given in a timely manner, before the start of the maneuver, and it must be discontinued immediately upon its completion (hand signals may be discontinued just before the start of the maneuver). Additionally, the signal must not mislead other participants in road traffic.

answers.answer: It should begin when the maneuver starts and stop when the maneuver is completed.
Immediately before the start of the maneuver and to cease immediately upon its completion.

question: In the given situation, the driver:
explanation: According to paragraph 1, sub-paragraph "b" of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, regardless of the indications of light and sound signals, no participant in road traffic should enter a railway crossing where the barrier or half-barrier is closed, is closing, or is rising. According to paragraph 2, sub-paragraph "b" of the same article, it is prohibited to arbitrarily open the barrier or half-barrier at a railway crossing. According to paragraph 3 of the same article, if movement is prohibited at the railway crossing, the driver must stop at the "STOP" line, at the 2.4 road sign, or at the traffic light, and in their absence, at least 5 meters from the barrier or half-barrier. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop at least 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: He has the right, with due regard for safety measures, to open the barrier himself and continue moving.
He has the right to bypass the barrier and continue moving.
There is an obligation to stop at the "Stop" line.
None of the answers listed on this ticket are correct.

question: The closing of the half-barrier has begun. The driver of the vehicle will not violate traffic rules if:
explanation: According to subparagraph “b” of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on “Traffic”, regardless of the indications of light and sound signals, no participant in road traffic should enter a railroad crossing where the barrier or half-barrier is closed, is closing, or is rising. According to the third paragraph of the same article, if movement at the railroad crossing is prohibited, the driver must stop at the “STOP” line, at the 2.4 road sign, or at the traffic light, and if these are not present, no less than 5 meters from the barrier or half-barrier. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop no less than 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: He will finish the movement because he manages to cross the railway crossing.
He will stop at the traffic light.
Make sure that no train approaches the crossing within sight and proceed through the railway crossing.

question: In the given situation, the driver must stop:
explanation: According to Paragraph 8 of Article 29 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," at a railway crossing, at the approach to a movable bridge, at a boat or ferry landing, on the road near a fire truck exit, and at the location where the flight path crosses the road at a low elevation, two alternating flashing lights directed to one side are used at one station and at the same height, or one flashing red or yellow light signal, of which the red light signal prohibits crossing the "STOP" line, and in its absence – crossing beyond the traffic light, while the yellow light signal means that drivers may continue to drive but are obliged to exercise special caution. According to Subparagraph "g" of Paragraph 1 of Article 39 of the same law, no road traffic participant should enter a railway crossing during a prohibitory signal from a regulator or traffic light, regardless of the state of the barrier or half-barrier or its existence. According to Paragraph 3 of the same article, if movement at the railway crossing is prohibited, the driver must stop at the "STOP" line, at the 2.4 road sign, or at a traffic light, and if these are not present – at least 5 meters from the barrier or half-barrier. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop at least 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: At least 10 meters away from the nearest rail.
At least 5 meters away from the nearest rail.

question: The half-barrier is closed. The driver will not violate traffic rules if:

question: In the given situation, the driver of the vehicle is obligated to:
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, during the prohibitory signal of a regulator or traffic light, no participant in road traffic should enter the railway crossing, regardless of the condition or existence of a barrier or half-barrier. Only the driver of the white car.

question: The regulator is standing towards the car on the right side, with his hands down. In this situation, the driver of the light vehicle:
explanation: According to paragraph 4 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, when giving a prohibitory signal at a railway crossing, the regulator stands facing the driver or with their back turned, with a raised stick above their head, a red lamp or flashlight, or with their arms extended to the sides.

answers.answer: He is obliged to reduce speed and stop.

question: In the given situation, the motorcycle rider:
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", if the railway crossing is not equipped with barriers, half-barriers, or light signals, no participant in road traffic should pass over it until they are assured that no rail vehicle is approaching within visible range.

answers.answer: Must stop at the traffic sign.

question: The train is finishing crossing the railway crossing. The driver of the vehicle has the right to continue moving.
explanation: According to subparagraph “g” of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, during the signal of a regulator or a prohibitory traffic light, no participant in road traffic should enter the railway crossing, regardless of the condition or existence of a barrier or half-barrier. According to paragraph 8 of Article 29 of the same law, at the railway crossing, at the approach to a movable bridge, at the arrival point of a ship or ferry, at the exit of a fire truck on the road, and at the point where the flight path crosses the road at a low height, two alternating flashing lights directed to one side, located at the same height at one station, are used, one of which is a flashing red light that prohibits crossing the “stop” line, and in its absence, prohibits passing beyond the traffic light, while the yellow flashing light indicates that drivers may continue to move, but are required to exercise special caution.

question: In the given situation, the driver of the vehicle is required to stop:
explanation: According to the subparagraph "b" of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, regardless of the signals and sound alerts, no participant in road traffic should enter a railroad crossing where the barrier or half-barrier is closed, being closed, or rising. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop no less than 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: At least 5 meters away from the half-barrier.
At least 10 meters away from the nearest rail.

question: In the given situation, the driver of the vehicle is required to stop:
explanation: According to paragraph "g" of the first point of article 39 of the Georgian law on "Road Traffic," during the red signal from the regulator or traffic light, no participant in road traffic should enter the railway crossing, regardless of the state or existence of a barrier or half-barrier. question: Does a driver have the right to stay in an occupied lane during a first overtaking if there are at least two lanes for simultaneous movement in the same direction, or will they have to start a new overtaking maneuver immediately after returning to the occupied lane or within a short period?
explanation: According to paragraph 6 of article 34 of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," if there are at least two lanes on a road for concurrent direction of traffic, a driver of a vehicle who must return to the lane they occupied during overtaking immediately after finishing the overtaking or shortly thereafter, and who will need to start a new overtaking maneuver, may remain in the lane occupied during the initial overtaking maneuver, provided they ensure in advance that this does not create an obstacle for the driver of the vehicle traveling behind them at a higher speed.

answers.answer: He/She does not have the right.
He has the right, if he is convinced in advance that this will not hinder the driver of the vehicle moving faster behind him.

question: In the given situation, which driver's vehicle is prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Rules," taking into account the requirements set out in paragraph 3 of this article, overtaking is prohibited at a railway crossing and within 100 meters in front of it, except in cases where traffic is regulated by a traffic signal of the type used at intersections. According to points 1.2 and 1.4.6-1.4.6 of the first section (warning signs) of the first annex of this law, the road sign: 1.2 "Railway Crossing without Barrier" - warns about approaching a railway crossing without a barrier; 1.4.3 "Approaching a Railway Crossing" - additionally warns the driver about approaching a railway crossing in an uninhabited area. According to subparagraphs "b" and "v" of the note in this section: b) signs 1.1 and 1.2 are repeated in an uninhabited area, the second sign is placed no less than 50 meters from the beginning of the dangerous section; v) signs 1.4.3 and 1.4.6 are placed again in the direction of traffic with signs 1.1 or 1.2.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the red car.
Only the driver of the blue car.

question: Apart from the case of exiting from the left side of the road, the driver who is sure that the driver coming behind him intends to overtake is obliged to:
explanation: According to point 12 of article 34 of the Georgian Law on “Road Traffic,” a driver who is convinced that the driver behind him intends to overtake must, as far as possible, approach the right edge of the roadway and not increase speed, except in the cases specified in subparagraph "b" of point 7 of article 32 of this law. Moreover, according to subparagraph "b" of point 7 of article 32 of this law, before turning right or left to exit onto another road or enter an area adjacent to the road, in such a way that does not violate the requirements set by point 2 of article 20 of this law and by the first and second points of this article, if the driver of the vehicle intends to exit the road from the left side, the vehicle, as far as possible, should approach the center of the roadway (on a two-way road) or the left edge of the roadway (on a one-way road).

answers.answer: Approach the right edge of the roadway and increase your speed.
Occupy the extreme left side of the corresponding lane and reduce speed.

question: In the given situation, the driver of the vehicle is obliged to:
explanation: According to paragraph 4 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," when a prohibitory signal is given at a railway crossing, the regulator stands towards the driver with their chest or back turned, holding a raised baton above their head, a red light, or arms extended sideways. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop at least 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: Stop at the nearest rail, no less than 10 meters away.

question: In the given situation, the driver of the vehicle is obliged to:
explanation: According to paragraph 4 of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Traffic, when a prohibitory signal is given at a railway crossing, the regulator stands facing the driver with their chest or turned away, with a raised baton above their head, with a red light or flare or with arms extended aside. According to subparagraph “g” of paragraph 1 of the same article, during a prohibitory signal from the regulator or traffic light, no participant in road traffic should enter the railway crossing, regardless of the state or presence of a barrier or half-barrier. According to paragraph 3 of the same article, if movement is prohibited at the railway crossing, the driver must stop at the “STOP” line, at the 2.4 traffic sign or traffic light, and in the absence of these – no less than 5 meters from the barrier or half-barrier. If there is neither a barrier nor a half-barrier, the driver must stop no less than 10 meters from the nearest rail.

answers.answer: Stop at the nearest rail, at a distance of no less than 10 meters.

question: If the insufficient width of the road, profile, or condition of the roadway, taking into account the intensity of oncoming traffic, does not provide an easy and safe opportunity for overtaking a slow-moving or oversized vehicle, the driver of this vehicle must:
explanation: According to paragraph 12 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, if the insufficient width, profile, or condition of the roadway does not allow a slow-moving or oversized vehicle to be overtaken easily and safely, considering the intensity of opposing traffic, the driver of that vehicle must reduce speed and, if necessary, yield the way to the vehicles behind them at the first opportunity.

answers.answer: In order to quickly traverse the given segment of the road, the speed must be increased.
He must slow down and yield to the vehicles behind him at the first opportunity if necessary.

question: In the given situation, is it prohibited for the driver to reverse the vehicle in the direction of the arrow and then perform a turning maneuver?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 15 and paragraph 16 of article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic": 15. It is prohibited to turn a vehicle at a railway crossing; 16. A driver who intends to turn or reverse must ensure that they can perform this maneuver without creating danger or hindering other participants in road traffic. If necessary, it is advisable to seek assistance from another person. Reversing is prohibited at an intersection, on a highway, and in the locations specified in paragraph 15 of this article.

question: In the given situation, on the flashing yellow light of the traffic signal:
explanation: According to paragraph 8 of Article 29 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, at the railway crossing, at the approach to a drawbridge, at the docking point of a ship or ferry, at the exit of a fire truck on the road, and at the location where the trajectory of an aircraft crosses the road at a low height, two alternating flashing lights directed to one side, or one flashing red or yellow light signal, which are arranged on the same level at one station, are used. The red light signal prohibits crossing the "STOP" line; if it is not present, it prohibits crossing beyond the traffic light. The yellow light signal indicates that drivers may continue to move, but they are also required to exercise special caution.

answers.answer: The driver is required to stop at the "STOP" line and wait for the signal to change.
The driver is obligated to stop at least 10 meters away from the nearest rail.
The driver has the right to continue driving with special caution.
The driver is required to stop at the traffic light.

question: In the given situation, is it prohibited for the driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 9 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article, overtaking is prohibited near a railway crossing and within 100 meters before it, except in cases where the movement in these areas is regulated by a type of traffic light that is used at intersections.

question: Which of the following places does the law allow the driver to use the lane that is more convenient for him?
explanation: According to paragraph 13 of Article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, considering the requirements established by Article 31 of this law (except for paragraph 5), in a populated area, on a road where there are at least two lanes for traffic in the same direction marked by longitudinal markings, a driver may use the lane that is more convenient for him/her (except in cases provided for by this law). The driver should only change to another lane in accordance with the rules regulating maneuvers for turning right or left, overtaking, stopping, or parking.

answers.answer: On any road in a populated area, if the driver is operating a slow-moving vehicle.
On the sections of the roadway in uninhabited and inhabited areas where movement is allowed at a speed exceeding 80 km/h.
In a populated area, on a road where there are at least two lanes for concurrent direction traffic, and they are marked with longitudinal markings.

question: In the given situation, is it prohibited for the driver of a light vehicle to overtake in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of the 9th point of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article, overtaking is prohibited at railway crossings and within 100 meters in front of them, except in cases where traffic at these locations is regulated by a type of traffic light used at intersections. According to points 1.2 and 1.4.6-1.4.6 of the first chapter (Warning Signs) of the first annex of this law, the traffic sign: 1.2 "Railway Uncontrolled Level Crossing" - warns of approaching an uncontrolled railway crossing; 1.4.1 "Approaching a Railway Crossing" - additionally warns the driver about approaching a railway crossing in an uninhabited area. According to the notes of this chapter points "a" and "v": a) Signs 1.1, 1.2, 1.5–1.34 are placed at a distance of 150-300 meters before the beginning of a dangerous section in uninhabited areas. v) Signs 1.4.1 and 1.4.4 are placed in the direction of traffic together with the primary and duplicate signs 1.1 or 1.2.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of the white car prohibited from moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph 2 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited to pass a stationary vehicle at a railway crossing by entering the lane of oncoming traffic. According to point 1.1 of the first chapter (horizontal markings) of the 2nd annex of this law, road marking 1.1 separates the flows of vehicles moving in opposite directions and indicates the boundary of the lane or the roadway at a dangerous section of the road, where entry is prohibited; it marks the boundary of the stopping place for vehicles and the edge of the roadway that does not belong to the highway under traffic conditions. Crossing the 1.1 line is prohibited. However, crossing the line that indicates the edge of the roadway and the 1.1 line located on the driver's right is allowed to stop the vehicle at the road’s edge.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of the blue light vehicle prohibited from overtaking in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," taking into account the requirements established by paragraph 3 of this article, overtaking is prohibited near a railroad crossing and within 100 meters in front of it, except in cases where traffic in these areas is regulated by a type of traffic light used at intersections. According to paragraphs 1.2 and 1.4.6-1.4.6 of the first section (warning signs) of the first annex of this law, the traffic sign: 1.2 "Railroad crossing without a barrier" warns about approaching a railroad crossing without a barrier; 1.4.3 "Approaching a railroad crossing" additionally warns the driver about approaching a railroad crossing in an uninhabited area. According to subparagraphs "b" and "d" of the notes of this section: b) Signs 1.1 and 1.2 are repeated in an uninhabited area, with the second sign placed at least 50 meters from the beginning of the dangerous section; d) Signs 1.4.3 and 1.4.6 are placed in the direction of traffic, repeated with signs 1.1 or 1.2.

question: In the given situation, does the driver have the right to continue moving without stopping if there is a blue flashing light and sound signals activated on the emergency service vehicle?
explanation: According to paragraph 4 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," when a prohibitory signal is given at a railway crossing, the regulator stands towards the driver either frontally or with their back turned, holding up a raised baton above their head, a red lantern, or a flashlight, or with their hands extended to the side. According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 7 of article 30 of the same law, a driver who is prohibited from moving by a signal from the regulator is required to stop before the railway crossing in accordance with paragraph 3 of article 39 of this law. According to paragraph 1 of article 51 of the same law, the driver of a vehicle belonging to an operational or special service, who has a blue flashing special light activated on the vehicle and is performing an official duty, may deviate from the obligations established by articles 25, 31-41, and 44 of this law, as well as from the requirements established by annexes №1 and №2 of this law, while ensuring compliance with the conditions for ensuring road traffic safety.

question: Is it prohibited for a driver of a vehicle being overtaken to hinder the overtaking by increasing speed or by any other action?
explanation: According to paragraph 16 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the driver of the overtaking vehicle is prohibited from interfering with the overtaking by increasing the speed of movement or through other actions.

question: If the lane designated for turning right at the intersection is separated from the rest of the roadway by an elevated safety island and there is no traffic light on the right before the intersection, the driver can make a right turn based on the traffic light present at the intersection:
explanation: According to subsection "Z" of paragraph 3 of Article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," if the lane designated for right turns at an intersection is separated from the rest of the roadway by an elevated safety island and there is no traffic light to the right before the intersection, the right turn is completed by yielding the road to all vehicles coming from other directions regardless of the signals from the traffic light at the intersection.

answers.answer: After activating the movement authorization signal.
Yielding the road to all vehicles moving from other directions independent of the traffic signals.

question: Does the driver of a red car have permission to enter the railway crossing if a traffic jam forms after the crossing?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, a driver must not enter a railway crossing unless they are assured in advance that they will not be forced to stop on it.

question: When approaching a railway crossing and while crossing it, the driver of the vehicle:
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of the first paragraph of Article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the driver of a vehicle must drive at a moderate speed; moreover, when crossing a railway track, the driver must use only the railway crossing and must yield to the train (locomotive, railcar).

answers.answer: It must move at a moderate speed, and when crossing the railway track, the driver should only use the railway crossing and yield to the train (locomotive, draisine).

He is required to quickly pass the specified section of the road; additionally, in the case of another vehicle stopping in front of the crossing, he should maneuver around it by moving into the opposite lane.

question: It is forbidden at the railway crossing:
explanation: According to subparagraphs "a," "b," and "c" of paragraph 2 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," it is prohibited at a railway crossing to: a) overtake a vehicle stopped in front of the railway crossing by going onto the opposite lane; b) arbitrarily open a barrier or half-barrier; c) transfer agricultural, road construction, and other vehicles and machinery into a non-transport mode that could damage the railway crossing or obstruct traffic on it;

answers.answer: By only exiting into the opposing traffic lane, overtaking the vehicle standing in front of the crosswalk.
Only the arbitrary opening of the barrier or half-barrier.
Only the transfer of agricultural, road construction, and other vehicles and machinery that may damage the crossing or hinder movement on it in a non-transportation state is allowed.
The implementation of any action listed in this ticket.

question: Is it prohibited to park vehicles on the roadway marked by the traffic sign ("main road") in an uninhabited area?
explanation: According to paragraph "v" of point 7 of article 37 of the law on road traffic of Georgia, the stopping of vehicles is prohibited in non-residential areas on the traffic lane indicated by road signs 2.1, 5.1, and 5.3, as well as in residential areas on the traffic lane where a speed of more than 80 km/h is permitted, except in specifically designated places.

answers.answer: It is not prohibited, only on the road where there are at least two lanes for traffic in the same direction.

question: In the case of a forced stop of a vehicle at a railway crossing, the following corresponds to the general alarm sound signal:
explanation: According to paragraph 6 of article 39 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the signal for the forced stop of a vehicle at a railway crossing is a circular hand movement (during the day – a bright colored cloth or any clearly distinguishable object, at night – a torch or a light). The common emergency signal is one long and three short sound signals.

answers.answer: Two long and two short audible signals
Three long and one short sound signal.
One long and three short sound signals.

question: Which of the road participants listed below are not prohibited from driving on motorways, as well as at the entrances and exits of motorways?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of paragraph one of article 38 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the movement of pedestrians, animals, bicycles, mopeds, two-wheeled electric scooters, and all other means of transportation that are different from motor vehicles and their trailers is prohibited on the motorway, at the entrance and exit of the motorway, as well as the movement of any vehicle (with or without a trailer) whose design speed does not exceed 40 km/h (this restriction does not apply to mechanical vehicles moving on the motorway in accordance with an agreement established by the legislation of Georgia with the competent authority (agency) and the conditions of that agreement).

question: On highways, as well as at the entrances and exits of highways, the movement of vehicles (with or without trailers) is prohibited without agreement with the authorized body (agency) if their design speed does not exceed:
explanation: According to paragraph "a" of the first part of Article 38 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," it is prohibited for pedestrians, animals, bicycles, mopeds, two-wheeled electric vehicles, and any other means of transport differing from cars and their trailers to move on the motorway, and at the entrance and exit of the motorway, as well as for any vehicle (with or without a trailer) whose design speed does not exceed 40 km/h (this restriction does not apply to mechanical vehicles that move on the motorway in accordance with the rules established by Georgian legislation upon coordination with the competent authority).

question: It is not prohibited on the highway, as well as at the entrance and exit of the highway:
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of the first section of article 38 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," learning to drive is prohibited on motorways, at entrances and exits of motorways. According to paragraph "g.b" of the same section, drivers are prohibited from turning around or reversing on motorways, at entrances and exits of motorways, as well as from entering the central divider and the lateral junctions of both lanes of the road.

answers.answer: Reversing or moving backward of the vehicle.
Exit from the central dividing line to the merging of both lanes of the road using a vehicle.
Movement with a vehicle intended for the transportation of those passengers beyond the second lane, whose permitted maximum mass exceeds 3.5 tons.

question: In populated areas, for leaving a stopping point, after the signal given based on the indicator of the intention to resume movement, drivers of the route transport vehicles are obliged to:
explanation: According to Paragraph 1 of Article 41 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic and considering the requirements established by Paragraph 4 of Article 33 of this law, in order to facilitate the movement of public transport vehicles in populated areas, drivers of other vehicles must slow down and, if necessary, stop so that the public transport vehicle can perform the maneuver required to exit from the stopping point. The driver of the public transport vehicle is obliged to take necessary precautions to prevent a road accident after signaling the intention to resume movement with the turn signal and to only begin moving once they are assured that other vehicles are yielding the right of way.

answers.answer: They should take advantage of the right of priority and immediately resume movement, regardless of the situation on the road.
Turn on the low beam headlights and then begin the maneuver.
Take the necessary precautions to avoid road-transport incidents and begin to move only after they are sure that other vehicles are yielding the road.

question: Is it prohibited to stop vehicles on the roadway in a manner that obstructs the movement of trams or trains, or near tram and railway tracks?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a.b" of paragraph 6 of article 37 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," it is prohibited to stop vehicles on the roadway where tram tracks or railway tracks are located or near them if this may obstruct the movement of trams or trains.

question: Demonstrations, auto rallies, promotional car races, automotive competitions, and technical testing of vehicles and their prototypes on highways are permitted:
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 38 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," a demonstration, car rally, advertising car race, or automobile competition on the motorway, as well as the technical testing of a vehicle and its prototype, is only permitted with a decision from the Executive Authority of Georgia or a local self-government body.

answers.answer: By the decision of the conducting body of the mentioned processes or the leadership of the society.
By decision of the executive authority or local self-government body.
by the decision of the participants involved in the mentioned processes

question: The driver of a passenger car is allowed to move to exit the highway:
explanation: According to paragraph 3 of article 38 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," when exiting the motorway, the driver must timely move to the lane adjacent to the exit of the motorway and enter the deceleration lane as quickly as possible, if such a lane exists.

answers.answer: In both direction A and B

question: A driver of a light vehicle is allowed to move to enter the highway:
explanation: According to paragraph 14 of Article 32 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," if there is an acceleration lane at the exit point of the road, the driver must move in that lane and yield to vehicles moving in the adjacent traffic lane when changing lanes. According to paragraph 2 of Article 38 of the same law, when entering the motorway, the driver is obliged to yield to vehicles already traveling on the motorway.
