question: Which identification sign is fixed on the front and rear of a vehicle transporting hazardous cargo?
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of the first paragraph of Article 19 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the driver, and in cases provided for by subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 18 of this law, the enterprise must attach the following identifying signs to the vehicles specified by this paragraph: g) "Dangerous Goods" - a rectangular orange plate measuring 400X300 mm with a black border 15 mm wide - on the front and rear sides of the transport vehicle carrying such cargo, and in the case of a tank, also on the sides (the bottom part of the plate must indicate the number of the cargo as per the United Nations organization, while the upper part must indicate the identification number of the hazard. They must be divided by a horizontal black line 15 mm thick, which crosses the plate at half its height).

question: What identifying mark is attached to the front and rear of a vehicle transporting large cargo?
explanation: According to subparagraph "d" of paragraph 1 of article 19 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", the driver, and in cases specified by subparagraph "d" of paragraph 1 of article 18 of this law, the enterprise is required to affix the following identification signs to the vehicles specified by this point: d) "Oversized (large-sized) cargo" - a board of size 400X400 mm, on which there are diagonally drawn alternating red and white stripes of 50 mm width with a reflective surface - is affixed to the front and rear of oversized (large-sized) vehicles and those defined by paragraph 13 of article 47 of this law.

question: Which reference mark is affixed to the rear of the vehicle, whose length exceeds 20 meters with or without cargo, and on a motor vehicle with two or more trailers?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of the first point of Article 19 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the driver, and in cases provided for by subparagraph "d" of the first point of Article 18 of this law, the enterprise is obligated to affix the following identification signs to the vehicles specified in this point: e) "Long vehicle" - a yellow rectangle measuring no less than 1200X200 mm with a 40 mm wide red border and reflective surface - is affixed to the rear of the non-standard (oversized) vehicle whose length exceeds 20 meters, whether loaded or unloaded, as well as to a combination of vehicles consisting of two or more trailers. If it is not possible to affix the sign of this size, it is permissible to affix two identical signs measuring no less than 600X200 mm symmetrically on the vehicle's axis.

question: Which of the given markers is mounted on the front and rear of the children's group transfer bus?
explanation: According to subparagraph "v" of the first paragraph of Article 19 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the driver, and in cases provided for by subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 18 of this law, the enterprise is obliged to affix the following signs on the vehicles specified by this paragraph: v) "Transportation of children" – a yellow square with a red border (the side of the square must be no less than 250 mm, the width of the border – 1/10 of the side), symbol 1.24 of the road sign with a black representation – is affixed to the front and rear of the bus that transports groups of children.

question: What identifying sign is attached to the front and rear of the mechanical vehicle driven by a hearing-impaired driver?
explanation: According to paragraph "z" of the first point of article 19 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," the driver, as well as in cases provided for by subparagraph "d" of the first point of article 18 of this law, the enterprise is obliged to place the following identification signs on the vehicles specified by this paragraph: z) "Hearing-impaired driver" – a yellow circle with a diameter of 160 mm, containing three black lines with a diameter of 40 mm, arranged at the corners of an imagined triangle with the apex pointing downwards – affixed to the front and rear of the mechanical vehicle driven by a hearing-impaired driver determined by the joint order of the Minister of Labor, Health and Social Affairs of Georgia and the Minister of Internal Affairs of Georgia.

question: Which identification sign is attached to the front and rear of a mechanical vehicle intended for driving instruction?
explanation: According to subparagraph "th" of the first paragraph of Article 19 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the driver, and in the cases provided for by subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 18 of this law, the enterprise is obliged to affix the following identification signs to the means of transport specified by this paragraph: th) "Training vehicle" – an upward-pointing white equilateral triangle with a red border, in which the black letter "S" is inscribed (the side of the triangle is no less than 200 mm, and the width of the border is 1/10 of the side) – it is affixed to the front and rear of the training vehicle. It is also permissible to place a double-sided sign on the roof of the light vehicle.

question: What identifying mark is affixed to the vehicle whose speed is less than the legally established limit considering the cargo and technical specifications?
explanation: According to subparagraph "i" of the first paragraph of Article 19 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the driver is required, and in the cases specified by subparagraph "d" of the first paragraph of Article 18 of this law, the company is obliged to affix the following informational signs to the vehicles specified by this paragraph: i) "Speed Limit" – a reduced colored representation of road sign 3.24, which indicates the permitted speed of movement (the diameter of the sign is not less than 160 mm, the width of the border is 1/10 of the diameter) – is affixed on the rear side, to the left, of the chassis of the non-standard (oversized) vehicle or the vehicle transporting dangerous cargo, driven by a driver with no more than 2 years of driving experience, as well as in the case when the maximum speed of the vehicle is lower than the one specified in paragraph 7 of Article 33 of this law.

question: Which identifying sign can be attached to the front and rear of the mechanical vehicle driven by persons with limited mobility, or to the vehicle transporting such individuals, at the driver's request?
explanation: According to Article 19, Paragraph 2, Subparagraph "a" of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," the following information signs may be affixed to a vehicle at the driver's discretion: a) "Person with Limited Abilities" - a yellow square with a 150 mm side and the symbol of traffic sign 8.17 with a black depiction - may be affixed to the front and rear of the mechanical vehicle operated by a person with a significantly expressed or distinctly expressed status of limited abilities, or on the vehicle that carries such individuals.

question: Which identification sign can be affixed to the vehicle that a doctor driver operates at the driver's request?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b" of paragraph 2 of article 19 of the law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the following identification signs may be placed on the vehicle at the driver's discretion: b) "Doctor" - a blue square of 140 mm per side, internally lined with a white circle of 125 mm in diameter, on which a red cross is depicted (height - 90 mm, stroke width - 25 mm) - may be placed on the vehicle operated by a driver who is a doctor.

question: Which of the given road signs provides information about the general speed limits established on the roads of Georgia?
explanation: According to paragraph 7.1 of Chapter 7 (Informational-Signaling Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", road sign 7.1 "General Speed Limitations" provides information about general speed restrictions established by road traffic rules on the roads of Georgia. The sign is installed at the entry point to the territory of Georgia, at the control checkpoint.

question: The given traffic sign is placed:
explanation: According to paragraph 7.1 of chapter 7 (Informative-Signaling Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road sign 7.1 "General Speed Limits" provides information about the general speed restrictions established by road traffic rules on the roads of Georgia. The sign is placed at the entry point to Georgia near the control checkpoint.

answers.answer: On the territory of Georgia, at the entrances, near the checkpoint crossing points.
At the beginning of the highway.

question: Which of the provided road signs indicates the speed recommended for traveling on that section of the road?
explanation: According to paragraph 7.2 of Chapter 7 (Informative-Signaling Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road sign 7.2 "Recommended Speed" indicates the speed at which movement is recommended on a specific section of the road. The sign is placed at the beginning of the road. The sign's validity extends to the nearest intersection, and along with the warning sign, it applies throughout the entire length of the hazardous area.

question: Which of the given traffic signs does not apply to the closest intersection beyond the location where the sign is placed?
explanation: According to subsection "d" of the note of point 4.1.1 of Chapter 4 (Guiding Signs) of the first annex of the “Traffic Regulations” law of Georgia, the effect of the “Moving Straight” sign, which is placed at the beginning of a road section, extends to the nearest intersection. According to point 7.2 of Chapter 7 (Informative-Signaling Signs) of the same law's first annex, the road sign 7.2 “Recommended Speed” indicates the speed at which movement is recommended on the specified road section. The sign is placed at the beginning of the road. Its effect extends to the nearest intersection, and together with the warning sign, it covers the entire length of the hazardous area. According to subsection "e" of the note of point 3 of Chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of the same law's first annex, the effect of the road sign 3.16 “Minimum Distance Restriction” extends from the appropriate sign to the nearest intersection from the location where the sign is installed, and in the absence of an intersection in a populated area – to the end of the populated area.

question: Which of the given road signs indicates an area where movement is only permitted for pedestrians?
explanation: According to Article 5.33 of Chapter 5 (Special Instructions Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the road sign 5.33 "Pedestrian Zone" indicates an area where movement is permitted only for pedestrians.

question: Which of the given road signs indicates the presence of an emergency stop lane on steep descents?
explanation: According to Article 7.5 of Chapter 7 (Informational and Indicative Signs) of the first annex of the "Traffic Movement" law of Georgia, road sign 7.5 "Emergency Stopping Lane" indicates the existence of an emergency stopping lane on a steep slope. The sign is placed in front of the entrance to the emergency stopping lane.

question: Which of the given road signs indicates a road that does not have a through exit?
explanation: According to paragraphs 7.8.1-7.8.3 of the first annex of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia (Informational and indicative signs), road signs 7.8.1-7.8.3 "Dead End" - a road that does not have a through exit. Sign 7.8.1 is installed at the beginning of the road, while signs 7.8.2 and 7.8.3 are placed before the intersection of the road that does not have a through exit.

question: Which of the given road signs indicates the length of the turning zone?
explanation: According to point 7.3.2 of the first annex of the "Road Traffic" law of Georgia (informational-signalling signs), road sign 7.3.2 "Turning Area" indicates the length of the turning area.

question: Which of the given road signs does not allow a left turn within its area of effect?
explanation: According to the note of points 7.3.1 and 7.3.2 of Chapter 7 (Informational-Signaling Signs) of the first appendix of the Georgian Law on “Road Traffic,” road signs 7.3.1 “Turnaround Area” and 7.3.2 “Turnaround Zone” are placed in front of or above the turnaround area, or in advance with sign 8.1.1. The signs do not permit a left turn.

question: Which of the given traffic signs allows a U-turn within its zone of operation?
explanation: According to subpoint "a" of the note of points 4.1.1-4.1.6 of Chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of the first annex of the Georgian law "On Road Traffic," the signs 4.1.1-4.1.6 indicate a movement direction represented only by arrows, while signs indicating permission to turn left also grant the right to make a U-turn. Furthermore, according to the notes of points 7.3.1 and 7.3.2 of Chapter 7 (Informative Signs) of the same annex, the road signs 7.3.1 "Place of U-turn" and 7.3.2 "U-turn Zone" are placed before or above the U-turn location, or in advance with sign 8.1.1. The signs do not permit turning left.

question: The given road sign:
explanation: According to paragraph 7.16 of Chapter 7 (Informational-Signalling Signs) of the first appendix of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," 7.16 “Traffic line” indicates the stopping place of a vehicle at a regulated intersection and an unregulated railway crossing.

answers.answer: Drivers are required to yield the right of way to vehicles moving on the intersecting road.
Prohibits the driver from continuing to move without stopping.
It indicates the stopping points of vehicles, regulated intersections, and unregulated railway crossings.

question: Which of the given road signs provides information about a swimming pool or beach?
explanation: According to paragraph 6.16 of Chapter 6 (Service Signs) of the first annex of the “Road Traffic Law” of Georgia, the road sign 6.16 “Swimming Pool or Beach” provides information to participants in road traffic about the relevant facility or service.

question: The combination of the given road signs indicates to the driver that:
explanation: According to paragraph 2.5 of Chapter II (Priority Signs) of Annex I of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," 2.5 "Priority for Oncoming Traffic" prohibits a driver from entering a narrow section of the road if it makes it difficult for traffic coming from the opposite direction. The driver is required to yield to oncoming vehicles that are located at an opposite entrance or on a narrow section of the road. According to paragraph 8.1.1 of Chapter VIII of the same annex (Additional Information Signs), sign 8.1.1 "Distance to Object" indicates the distance from the sign to the beginning of the dangerous section, to the location of the respective restriction or ahead, to a specific object (destination) in the direction of traffic.

answers.answer: The driver is required to yield to oncoming traffic at a distance of 300 meters from the sign.
After 300 meters from the sign, there is a narrow section of the road where the driver is required to yield to oncoming traffic.
A section of a two-way road begins, and for a distance of 300 meters, the driver is required to yield the road to oncoming vehicles.

question: The given traffic signs provide the driver with information that ahead of the location of the sign:
explanation: According to point 1.17 of the first chapter (warning signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, and according to sub-point “a” of the note of the same chapter, road sign 1.17 “uneven road” indicates a section of the road where the roadway is damaged by wave-like, gravelly, uneven connections near a bridge, etc. Signs 1.1, 1.2, and 1.5–1.34 are installed in an uninhabited area at a distance of 150–300 meters before the beginning of a dangerous section. According to point 8.2.1 of the eighth chapter (additional information signs (plates)) of the same annex, plate 8.2.1 “action zone” indicates the length of the dangerous section of the road marked by a warning sign, or the action zone of prohibitory and informative-indicative signs. According to point 7.2 of the seventh chapter (informative-indicative signs) of the same annex, road sign 7.2 “recommended speed” indicates the speed recommended for movement in the given section of the road. The sign is installed at the beginning of the road. The sign's action extends to the nearest junction, and together with the warning sign – along the entire length of the dangerous section.

answers.answer: There is an uneven road over a distance of 400 meters, where it is recommended to drive at a speed of 30 km/h.
After 400 meters, the uneven road begins, where a speed of 30 km/h is recommended.
After 150-300 meters, an uneven road of 400 meters in length begins, where it is recommended to drive at a speed of 30 km/h.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of the white car forbidden to move in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the note "a" of point 4.1.1 of Chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of the first annex of the "Road Traffic Law" of Georgia, the road sign 4.1.1 "Straight Movement" allows movement only in the directions indicated by arrows. According to point 8.18 of Chapter 8 (Additional Information Signs (Boards)) of the same annex, the board 8.18 "Except for persons with disabilities" indicates that the sign does not apply to the vehicle on which the identification sign "Person with a Disability" is affixed.

question: In the given situation, is it prohibited for the driver of the yellow car to move in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to the note "a" of paragraph 4.1.1 of Chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of Annex 1 of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic," the road sign 4.1.1 "Move Straight" allows movement only in the directions indicated by the arrows. According to paragraph 8.18 of Chapter 8 (Additional Information Signs (Plates)) of the same annex, sign 8.18 "Except for persons with disabilities" indicates that the sign's effect does not apply to the vehicle on which the identification sign "Person with a disability" is affixed.

question: The given road sign indicates to the driver that ahead from the location of the signs:
explanation: According to Article 3.24 of Chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of Annex 1 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the road sign 3.24 "Maximum Speed Limit" prohibits movement at a speed greater than that indicated on the sign (km/h). According to Paragraph 8.2.1 of Chapter 8 (Additional Information Signs (Panels)) of the same annex, the panel 8.2.1 "Zone of Action" indicates the length of the dangerous section of the road marked with a warning sign or the zone of action for the prohibitory and informational display signs.

answers.answer: Movement is prohibited at speeds greater than 50 km/h within a distance of 300 meters.
Movement is prohibited at speeds over 50 km/h after 300 meters.

question: The given combination of road signs indicates to the driver that ahead from the location of the signs:
explanation: According to paragraph 3.24 of chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road sign 3.24 "Maximum Speed Limit” prohibits movement at a speed exceeding that indicated on the sign (km/h). According to paragraph 8.1.1 of chapter 8 (Additional Information Signs (Boards)) of the same annex, board 8.1.1 "Distance to Object" indicates the distance from the sign to the beginning of a hazardous section, to the point where the respective restriction is imposed, or ahead, to a specific object in the direction of travel (to a place).

answers.answer: Movement is allowed within a distance of 300 meters, at a speed not exceeding 50 km/h.
Movement is permitted after 300 meters, not exceeding a speed of 50 km/h.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to stop:
explanation: According to paragraph 3.27 of Chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of the first annex of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic", road sign 3.27 "No Parking" prohibits both stopping and standing of vehicles. According to the note "Z.D" of the same chapter, the effective zone of signs 3.27-3.30 is reduced by placing repeated signs 3.27-3.30 at the end of their zone of action with sign 8.2.3 or by using sign 8.2.2, or by placing the sign 8.2.1 "Parking Place" with sign 7.4.

answers.answer: Both A and B in place.

question: In the given situation, which driver is prohibited from turning the vehicle in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to Article 1.11 of the first section of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 1.11 separates opposing or same-direction traffic flows on a road segment where merging is allowed only from one lane; it indicates a turning location, the exit and entrance from a parking lot, etc., where movement is allowed only on one side. Crossing line 1.11 is permitted from the side of a broken line, as well as from the side of a continuous line, but only at the end of overtaking or maneuvering.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the white car.
Not a single driver of a vehicle.

question: In the given situation, which driver is prohibited from turning the vehicle in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 1.11 of the first section of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road markings 1.5 separates traffic flows moving in opposite directions on a road that has two or three lanes; it indicates the boundary of a traffic lane when there are two or more lanes designated for traffic moving in one direction. Crossing line 1.5 is permitted from any side.

answers.answer: Only the driver of the yellow car.
Only the driver of the red car.
Not a single driver of a car

question: At an intersection, when there is existing road signage, the driver of a light vehicle has the right to continue moving:
explanation: According to paragraph 1.7 of the first section (horizontal marking) of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," road marking 1.7, consisting of a dashed line with short dashes and equal spacing, indicates movement lanes within an intersection. Crossing line 1.7 is permitted from any side.

answers.answer: Only in the direction of A.
Only in the direction of C
As in the direction of A and B, also C.

question: In the presence of a wound of an injured person due to a road-traffic accident, iodine solution is used as a disinfectant.
explanation: In the case of a wound from a road traffic accident, iodine solution is used as a disinfectant to treat the edges of the wound and the adjacent skin.

answers.answer: To treat the entire surface of the wound.
For the treatment of the edges of the wound and the surrounding skin.

question: Did the driver of the light vehicle violate the traffic rules while moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "a.g" of paragraph 9 of article 34 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, overtaking is prohibited on an intersection that is different from a roundabout intersection or directly in front of such an intersection, except in cases where overtaking is carried out without leaving the lane of oncoming traffic at a regulated intersection.

question: Does the driver of a light vehicle have the right to stop at the indicated location to drop off a passenger?
explanation: According to paragraph 1.4 of the first section (horizontal marking) of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the entire yellow line indicates a place where stopping is prohibited; it may be marked independently or together with sign 3.27; it is drawn at the edge of the roadway or above the curb.

question: The markings on the roadway indicate:
explanation: According to point 1.22 of the first section (horizontal signage) of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road signage 1.22 indicates the number of the road (route).

answers.answer: designated traffic lanes for route transport vehicles of the corresponding number

question: The yellow marking on the road surface indicates:
explanation: According to paragraph 1.17 of the first section (horizontal markings) of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the yellow line indicates the stopping place for public transport vehicles and the taxi stand.

answers.answer: A place to stay for a long vacation.

question: The transverse marking on the roadway indicates the place where:
explanation: According to point 1.15 of the first chapter (horizontal signage) of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road signage 1.15 indicates the location where a bicycle path crosses the roadway.

answers.answer: The pedestrian path crosses the roadway.
The bicycle path crosses the roadway.

question: A double broken line marked on the roadway indicates:
explanation: According to paragraph 1.9 of the first section (horizontal markings) of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 1.9 indicates the boundary of a lane organized for reverse movement; it separates traffic flows moving in opposite directions (when the reverse traffic light is off) on a roadway that is organized for reverse movement.

answers.answer: The place where the driver must stop in case of necessity.
the boundaries of reverse-ordered movement lanes

question: Crossing the continuous line marking the edge of the road surface is allowed if the driver is moving:
explanation: According to Article 1.2.1 of the first section of the Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 1.2.1 indicates the edge of the roadway on a highway. Crossing line 1.2.1 is prohibited. However, it is allowed to cross line 1.2.1, which indicates the edge of the roadway on the driver's right side, to stop the vehicle at the edge of the road.

question: The inscription "BUS" on the road surface indicates a special lane designated for:
explanation: According to point 1.23 of the first section (Horizontal Markings) of Annex 2 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 1.23 indicates a special lane designated for the movement of public transport vehicles.

question: The arrow-shaped marking placed in the middle of the traffic lane on the roadway warns:
explanation: According to paragraph 1.19 of the first section (horizontal marking) of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 1.19 provides a warning about the narrowing of the roadway, at the section where the number of traffic lanes in the given direction is reduced, or regarding the approach to the separating markings 1.1 or 1.11 for the opposite direction of traffic. The marking 1.19 may be used in the first case together with markings 1.21.1–1.21.3.

answers.answer: Regarding approaching a section of road with a dangerous curve.
Regarding the narrowing of the roadway, at the section where the number of lanes in the given direction of movement decreases.

question: The vertical marking drawn on the bridge indicates:
explanation: According to paragraph 2.2 of the second chapter of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, road marking 2.2 indicates the lower edge of the element of a tunnel, bridge, overpass, and other structure that is located at a height of less than 5 meters from the roadway and beneath which the roadway passes completely or partially.

answers.answer: the number of lanes on the roadway

The lower edge of the elements of tunnels, bridges, overpasses, and other structures that are located at a height of less than 5 m from the roadway and under which the roadway passes entirely or partially.

question: In the given situation, is the driver prohibited from stopping the vehicle in the indicated place with the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 3.27 of Chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of the first annex of the Georgian Law on "Road Traffic", traffic sign 3.27 "Stopping is prohibited" prohibits both stopping and parking of vehicles. According to subparagraph "e" of the notes of the same chapter, the effect of signs 3.26-3.30 extends beyond the respective sign, from the location of the sign to the nearest intersection, and in a populated area, in the absence of an intersection, to the end of the populated area. The effect of the signs also extends to the exit from adjacent property, crossing (joining) field, forestry, and other secondary roads where there is no respective sign in front of them. According to paragraph 13 of Article 5 of this law, an intersection is a level crossing of roads, merging, or branching, including the territories created by such crossing, merging, or branching. Crossing of exit roads from adjacent properties with roads is not considered as an intersection.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to stop:
explanation: According to paragraph 1.4 of the first section (horizontal marking) of Annex II of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the entire yellow line indicates a place where stopping is prohibited; it may be marked independently or along with sign 3.27; it is drawn at the edge of the roadway or above the curb. According to paragraph 3.27 of the third section (prohibitory signs) of the first Annex of this law and sub-paragraph "t" of the remarks in the same section, road sign 3.27 “Stopping is prohibited” prohibits both stopping and parking of vehicles. The use of sign 3.27 can be in conjunction with marking 1.4, while sign 3.28 can be used along with marking 1.10. Furthermore, the operational zone of the signs is defined by the length of the marking line.

answers.answer: Neither A nor B in place.

question: If the injured person in a road traffic accident has a wound on the eye, they should:
explanation: In the case of an eye wound resulting from a road-transport accident, the injured person should be laid on their back and the head should be tilted forward. A clean dressing should be placed on the injured eye.

answers.answer: Let's lay him on his back and lift his head forward. We should place a clean cloth on the injured eye.
Let’s lay the patient on their side, with the healthy eye facing up. Place a clean dressing on the injured eye.
Let's place the person in a semi-reclining position. Tilt the head back and apply a clean dressing to the injured eye.

question: In the case of a fracture of the forearm bone below the elbow in a victim of a traffic accident, a tourniquet to stop arterial bleeding should be applied.
explanation: In the case of a fracture of the forearm bone below the elbow due to a road traffic accident injury, a pressure bandage should be applied above the elbow, near the shoulder, to stop arterial bleeding.

answers.answer: Above the elbow, near the shoulder.
Above the wound to the elbow.

question: To report the need for emergency medical assistance for those injured in a road transport accident, the dispatcher should be informed:
explanation: To call for emergency medical assistance for those injured in a road transport accident, the dispatcher must be informed of the exact location of the road transport accident (street, house number, and nearest landmark), the number of injured, their gender, approximate age, presence of vital signs, as well as any severe bleeding.

answers.answer: The precise location of the road traffic accident (street, house number, and nearest landmark), number of injured persons, their gender, approximate age, presence of vital signs, as well as information about severe bleeding.
Only the nearest landmark to the traffic accident site, the number of injured, their gender, and age.

question: Does a truck driver violate traffic rules when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to point 3.22 of Chapter 3 (Prohibitory Signs) of the first annex of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the road sign 3.22 "Overtaking by vehicles over 3.5 tons is prohibited" prohibits overtaking by freight vehicles with a maximum allowed mass exceeding 3.5 tons of other vehicles (except for vehicles moving at a speed of less than 30 km/h), as well as overtaking by tractors of other vehicles (except for motorized transport and bicycles).

question: If the injured person in a road-transport accident shows injuries at the hairy area of the head, in order to provide first aid, they should:
explanation: If the injured person shows bruises on the hairy parts of the head as a result of a road-transportation accident, in order to provide initial medical assistance, an improvised bandage should be applied to the neck, a sterile dressing should be placed on the wound, the injured person should be laid on their side with their knees bent, and ice or a cold pack should be placed on their head.

answers.answer: An improvised dressing should be placed on the neck, a sterile cotton swab should be placed on the wound, and the injured person should be laid on their back.

An improvised dressing should be placed on the neck, a sterile bandage should be applied to the wound with a compress, and the injured person should be laid on their side with legs bent at the knees, while ice or a cold pack should be placed on their head.

question: The driver of a light vehicle is allowed to stop:
explanation: According to Article 37, Paragraph 6, Subparagraphs "a.a" and "a.g" of the Law of Georgia on Traffic, it is prohibited to stop a vehicle on the roadway: a.a) near pedestrian and cyclist crossings and within 5 meters in front of them; a.g) at road intersections, as well as within 5 meters of their crossing edges, except in cases where stopping occurs at opposite three-way intersections (junctions) that have a continuous line or a dividing strip marked.

answers.answer: As at location A, so at location B.

question: Which vehicle driver is obliged to yield the road when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph 6 of article 43 of the law “On Road Traffic” of Georgia, cyclists and moped drivers must yield to the drivers of vehicles traveling on the road when crossing an unregulated intersection beyond the intersection.

question: What is the maximum speed allowed for a driver of a category "B" vehicle to continue driving in the area of a road sign?
explanation: According to subparagraph "b.b" of paragraph 7, and paragraphs 9 and 10 of Article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic": 7. Except for cases established by this law, in uninhabited areas, as well as in inhabited areas on the sections of the road where movement is permitted at speeds exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of Category B vehicles is allowed if they are towing a light trailer, at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h on all roads. 9. In addition to the maximum speed limit defined by paragraphs 6-8 of this article, the driver is prohibited from: a) exceeding the maximum design speed established for the vehicle; b) exceeding the speed indicated on the sign "Speed Limit" affixed to the vehicle; g) exceeding the maximum speed set by road signs. 10. Despite the permission to drive at higher speeds indicated by relevant road signs or signals, the driver is prohibited from exceeding the maximum speed limit established for him by paragraphs 6-9 of this article. According to points 3.24 and 8.14 of the first annex of this law, road signs: - 3.24. "Maximum Speed Limit" - prohibits movement at a speed exceeding that indicated on the sign (km/h). - 8.14. "Traffic Lane" - indicates the traffic lane to which the sign or traffic light applies. The sign is positioned above the traffic lane.

question: What direction is the "D1" subcategory vehicle driver allowed to continue driving on this section of the highway?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 7 of article 33 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," except for the cases established by this law, in unpopulated areas, as well as in populated areas on the section of the road where movement is permitted at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of vehicles of subcategories "D1" and "D1E" is allowed on all roads at a speed not exceeding 80 km/h. According to paragraph 4.6 of chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of the first annex of this law, 4.6 "Minimum Speed Limit" - establishes the minimum speed limit for movement on the road. The sign's effect applies from the sign onward to the nearest intersection from the location of the sign, and in the absence of an intersection in the populated area, to the end of the populated area. According to paragraph 8.14 of chapter 8 (Supplementary Information Signs (Panels)) of the same annex, 8.14 "Traffic Lane" - indicates the traffic lane to which the sign or traffic light applies. The panel is placed above the traffic lane.

answers.answer: Both in direction A and direction B.

question: What speed is a driver of a "B" category vehicle allowed to continue driving in the lane indicated by the road sign?
explanation: According to paragraph 4.6 of Chapter 4 (Directional Signs) of the first annex to the Law of Georgia on “Road Traffic”, 4.6 "Minimum Speed Limit" establishes the minimum speed limit for movement on the road. The sign is effective from the sign itself to the nearest intersection following the sign, and in the absence of an intersection within a populated area, to the end of the populated area. According to paragraph 8.14 of Chapter 8 of this annex (Additional Information Signs (Panels)), 8.14 "Traffic Lane" indicates the traffic lane to which the sign or traffic light applies. The panel is placed above the traffic lane. According to subparagraph "b.a" of paragraph 7 of Article 33 of the same law, in addition to the cases established by this law, in unpopulated areas, as well as on the section of the road where movement is allowed at a speed exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of vehicles of category B is permitted unless they are towing a light trailer, at a speed not exceeding 110 km/h on the motorway, and not exceeding 90 km/h on other roads.

answers.answer: At least 50 km/h and no more than 70 km/h speed.
At least 50 km/h and no more than 90 km/h speed.
At least 50 km/h and no more than 110 km/h speed.

question: What direction is the driver of a "C1" category vehicle allowed to continue moving on this section of the road?
explanation:
According to paragraph 4.6 of Chapter 4 (Indicative Signs) of Annex I of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," "Minimum Speed Limit" establishes the minimum speed limit for movement on the road. The sign's effect extends from the sign itself to the nearest intersection, and in the absence of an intersection in an inhabited area – to the end of the inhabited area.

According to paragraph 8.14 of Chapter 8 of the same annex (Additional Information Signs), "Movement Lane" indicates the movement lane to which the sign or traffic light applies. The sign is placed above the movement lane.

According to subparagraph "d.a" of paragraph 7 of Article 33 of this law, except for cases established by this law, in uninhabited areas and also in inhabited areas on the road section where movement is allowed at speeds exceeding 60 km/h, the movement of vehicles of categories "C" and "CE," as well as subcategories "C1" and "C1E" is permitted on highways at speeds not exceeding 80 km/h, and on other roads – at speeds not exceeding 70 km/h.

answers.answer: In both directions A and B.

question: Which driver's transport vehicle is required to yield when moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 4 of Article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," at an unregulated intersection, when crossing roads of equal importance, the driver of a non-motorized vehicle is obliged to yield the way to a vehicle approaching from the right.

answers.answer: A driver of a light vehicle.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of a light vehicle required to stop at a traffic light that shows a red signal when moving in the direction of the arrow at the intersection exit?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 3 of article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic Regulations," a driver entering a regulated intersection on a green signal of the traffic light may proceed in the intended direction, despite the prohibitory signals at the exit of the intersection, provided that it does not obstruct the movement of other road users in the direction where movement is permitted. If there are "STOP" lines (and/or road sign 7.16) at the traffic lights on the road during the driver's movement through the intersection, the driver must comply with each traffic light signal.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of a light vehicle required to stop at the traffic light indicating a prohibition on movement when moving in the direction of the arrow at the exit of an intersection?
explanation: According to paragraph "e" of the 3rd point of Article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic", a driver entering a regulated intersection on a green traffic signal is allowed to move in the intended direction despite the prohibitory signals at the exit of the intersection, provided that it does not obstruct the movement of other road users in the direction where movement is allowed. If there are "STOP" lines (and/or 7.16 traffic signs) in front of the traffic signals while moving through the intersection, the driver must obey each traffic signal.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of a light vehicle obligated to stop at a traffic light indicating a prohibition of movement while moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to paragraph "e" of paragraph 3 of article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic", a driver entering a regulated intersection on a traffic signal indicating permission may move in the designated direction despite the prohibitory signals at the exit of the intersection, provided that it does not obstruct the movement of other road users in the direction where the traffic is open. If there are "STOP" lines (and/or road signs 7.16) in front of the traffic signals on the road at the intersection during the driver's movement, the driver must obey each traffic signal.

question: In the given situation, is the driver of a light vehicle required to stop at a traffic light indicating a no-movement signal while moving in the direction of the arrow?
explanation: According to subparagraph "e" of paragraph 3 of Article 36 of the Law of Georgia on "Traffic," a driver entering an intersection with a traffic light showing a permissive signal may proceed in the intended direction despite the prohibitive signals at the exit of the intersection, provided that this does not obstruct other road users moving in the direction that is open for traffic. If there are "STOP" lines (and/or road signs 7.16) in front of the traffic lights while moving through the intersection, the driver must obey the signals of each traffic light.

question: To remove a foreign body from the respiratory tract of an injured person in a road-traffic incident, it is necessary to:
explanation: To remove a foreign body from the airway of an injured person in a road traffic accident, you must pound the back several times with the palm of your hand. If that does not yield positive results, stand behind the injured person, place your hands in fists at the level of the lower ribs against the abdomen, and simultaneously apply pressure on the ribs while sharply thrusting your fists inward and upward in the abdominal area.

answers.answer: If there is a negative outcome, we should stand behind the injured person after hitting several times on the back with the palm, clasp our hands into fists at the level of the lower ribs against the abdomen, simultaneously apply pressure on the ribs and sharply punch the abdominal area inward and upward.
Let's put the injured person on their knees with their face down and punch their back several times.

question: What direction can the driver of a light vehicle continue to move at this signal from the traffic controller?
explanation: According to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 5 of article 30 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," the signals of the traffic controller have the following meaning - an outstretched right hand indicates the "stop" signal for all drivers approaching from the right side and behind the traffic controller; additionally, a tram has the right to move left from the traffic controller's left side, while a non-engine driven vehicle has the right to move in all directions. All vehicles have the right to move only to the right from the traffic controller's chest side. A pedestrian has the right to cross the roadway behind the traffic controller. According to paragraph 2 of article 28 of the same law, the signals of the traffic controller take precedence over the light signals of traffic lights, traffic signs and markings, and the requirements of road traffic rules. At an intersection, the prohibitory and directive road signs continue to be in effect when traffic is being regulated by the traffic controller, except in cases where the traffic controller specifically indicates that their requirements may be disregarded.

answers.answer: Only in the directions of A, B, and D.
Only in the A and D directions.

question: What direction can the driver of a light vehicle continue to move if the traffic officer specifically indicates to turn left?
explanation: According to paragraph 2 of article 28 of the Law of Georgia on Road Traffic, the signals of the regulator have priority over the light signals of traffic lights, the requirements of road signs, road markings, and the rules of road traffic. At an intersection, while regulating traffic by the regulator, prohibitory and directive road signs continue to be in effect unless the regulator specifically indicates the disregard of their requirements.

answers.answer: Only to the left and in reverse direction (turning).

question: Is it permitted to administer medicinal substances to an injured person in a state of unconsciousness as a result of a road traffic accident?
explanation: It is not permitted to administer medicinal substances to an injured person in an unconscious state as a result of a road traffic accident.

question: In the case of a fracture of the hand bone of a person injured in a road traffic accident due to the absence of materials for making a splint, it should:
explanation: In the absence of materials for preparing an arm, in the case of a fracture of the wrist bone due to a road transport accident, the injured arm should be suspended around the neck bent at the elbow and secured to the body with a bandage.

answers.answer: We will secure the corrected limb to the body with a bandage wrap.
We should wrap the arm bent at the elbow around the neck and secure it to the body with a bandage.

question: How does the braking distance of a light vehicle change when towing a trailer that does not have a braking system?
explanation: The heavier the vehicle, the more force and time are required for its braking. The braking distance of a light vehicle increases when towing a trailer that does not have a braking system.

question: We perceive the speed of an approaching vehicle in the dark hours of the day and under conditions of insufficient visibility:
explanation: During the bright daylight, the speed of oncoming vehicles is determined by the human eye relative to other existing landmarks in the space (such as road signs, markings, roadside greenery, etc.), while at night and under conditions of inadequate visibility, orientation relies solely on the light of the headlights, making us perceive the speed of oncoming vehicles as less than it actually is.

question: Fuel consumption during the initial movement of a vehicle equipped with a mechanical gearbox in first gear during prolonged idling:
explanation: When a vehicle with a mechanical transmission is in motion in first gear, the speed is low, while the engine operates at a high RPM and requires more fuel. During prolonged idling of a vehicle in first gear when starting to move, fuel consumption increases.

question: In which case is a light vehicle more stable against rollover when turning?
explanation: The higher the center of gravity of a vehicle is positioned, the lower its stability against overturning, regardless of the nature of the cargo. The center of gravity of a loaded vehicle is always positioned higher than that of an unloaded one.

question: What type of profile does a fuel tanker have to be more stable against tipping while turning?
explanation: The higher the center of gravity of a transport vehicle is located, the lower its stability against tipping over, regardless of the nature of the load. The center of gravity of a loaded vehicle is always positioned higher than that of an unloaded one. The center of gravity of an elliptical profile tank truck is positioned lower than that of a round profile tank truck, therefore the elliptical profile tank truck is more stable against tipping over.

question: A vehicle is more resistant to overturning if its center of gravity is located:
explanation: The higher the center of gravity of a vehicle, the lower its stability against overturning, regardless of the nature of the load. The center of gravity of a loaded vehicle is always positioned higher than that of an unloaded one.

question: In the case of transporting liquid cargo, a tank truck is more resistant to tipping over when the tank is full.
explanation: The higher the center of gravity of a vehicle, the lower its stability against tipping over, regardless of the nature of the cargo. The center of gravity of a loaded vehicle is always higher than that of an unloaded one. In the case of transporting liquid cargo in a tank truck, it should also be considered that in a non-filling tank, the liquid has the ability to move, which generates additional inertial forces and reduces the vehicle's stability against tipping over.

question: While maneuvering around a corner, a car's skidding, overturning, and folding can be caused by:
explanation: When navigating a turn, speed selection should take into account the significant risk of the vehicle sliding, tipping over, and overturning. We should pass through turns slowly, avoiding sharp braking, and drive at a low speed. A sharp turn of the steering wheel, sudden braking, or excessive speed can lead to the vehicle's sliding, overturning, and tipping over due to the significant inertia of the trailer.

answers.answer: Only the sharp turn of the steering wheel
Both excessive speed and sharp turns of the steering wheel and abrupt braking

question: Sliding, overturning, and folding of the vehicle may be caused while driving on a slippery road, uphill:
explanation: In winter conditions while driving uphill, the driver should engage low gear or activate the transfer case to eliminate the need to shift gears while climbing, which can in turn lead to slippage of the drive wheels. Under icy road conditions on an incline, the vehicle will be unable to regain forward movement, and the trailer may begin to slide backward uncontrollably. Sharp steering changes or braking on slippery roads can also lead to slippage, tipping, or overturning of the vehicle and its trailer.

answers.answer: Only the sharp turn of the steering wheel
Just like the sharp turn of the steering wheel, so does the sudden braking.

question: An effective method of braking when a vehicle equipped with a mechanical transmission is moving down a steep slope is:
explanation: An effective way to brake a vehicle with a manual transmission while going down a steep slope is engine braking. The steeper the slope, the more caution is required. When engine braking a car with a manual transmission on a sharp descent, the driver should engage a lower gear, the steeper the slope is, the lower the gear should be.

answers.answer: Periodic sharp braking with the connection turned off.
Periodic slow braking with a connected linkage and transmission gearbox.

question: When braking with the engine on a sharp descent in a vehicle with a mechanical transmission, the driver must take into account that:
explanation: The steeper the descent, the more caution is needed. When braking with the engine on a steep slope in a vehicle with a manual transmission, the driver should engage a lower gear the steeper the descent is.

answers.answer: The steeper the slope, the higher the transmission should be.
The steeper the incline, the lower the gear should be.
The selection of gear is not dependent on the steepness of the slope.

question: The likelihood of creating an emergency situation while moving in a dense traffic flow is lower if the speed of your vehicle matches the traffic flow.
explanation: The likelihood of creating a dangerous situation while moving in a dense traffic flow is lower if the speed of your vehicle matches the speed of the traffic flow.

answers.answer: It is significantly more than the speed.
It is significantly less than the speed.

question: When turning, if the rear axle of the front-wheel-drive vehicle skids, the driver must:
explanation: In case of rear axle slipping of a rear-wheel-drive vehicle, the driver should slightly increase the fuel supply and steer to correct the direction of movement.

answers.answer: To brake and turn the steering wheel towards the sliding side.
Reduce fuel supply and do not change the steering position.
Slightly increase the fuel supply and adjust the direction of movement with the steering wheel.

question: When turning, if the rear axle of a rear-wheel-drive vehicle starts to skid, the driver should:
explanation: When turning, if the rear axle of a rear-wheel-drive vehicle starts to skid, the driver should slightly reduce the throttle and steer into the direction of the skid.

answers.answer: Brake and turn the steering wheel toward the direction of the skid.
Slightly reduce the fuel supply and turn the steering wheel towards the sliding side.
Slightly increase the fuel supply and do not change the position of the steering wheel.

question: When there is deep snow on the road, the driver of the vehicle must drive:
explanation: When there is deep snow on the roadway, in the case of driving on dirt roads, the driver of the vehicle should move with a pre-selected transmission and speed without stopping, and avoid sharp turns of the steering wheel.

answers.answer: Pre-selected low gear and speed, without sharp turns and stops.
Depending on the condition of the road surface, transfer and speed change.

question: The dynamic corridor of a car and a connected bus is greater than the dynamic corridor of an individual vehicle when moving through a turn.
explanation: The lane required for the movement of the automobile and connected buses significantly widens when turning at the intersection. During the turn, the front wheels of the steering vehicle occupy the side opposite to the center of the turn, while the rear wheels of the vehicle and its trailer are on the side of the center of the turn. The dynamic corridor for the automobile and connected buses is 10-40% larger than that of a single vehicle and a regular bus.

question: At what moment is it advisable to release the parking brake when starting to move on an incline?
explanation: When starting to move on an incline, it is advisable to release the parking brake simultaneously with the start of movement.

answers.answer: Before the start of the movement
After the start of the movement
Simultaneously with the start of the movement

question: The driver of the passenger transport vehicle must take into account during movement in winter conditions at the specified stop that:
explanation: When driving in winter conditions, the driver of public transport must take into account that multiple braking at a stop can create a slippery section. Therefore, when approaching the mentioned stop, the driver should reduce the speed sufficiently in advance to eliminate the risk of sliding during braking. Otherwise, the vehicle may skid, putting passengers at the stop in danger.

answers.answer: Repeated braking leads to the formation of an icy section.
Due to the high intensity of traffic, the road surface is dry.
The surface of the roadway does not change due to winter conditions.

question: When overtaking with a motor vehicle and a connected bus, it is advisable that the safe lateral interval with respect to the vehicle being overtaken should not be:
explanation: According to paragraph 5 of article 34 of the "Road Traffic" law of Georgia, in order to ensure safety, at the moment of overtaking, the driver must leave enough lateral space for the vehicle(s) being overtaken. Before overtaking, the driver must ensure that the width of the roadway allows for maintaining a lateral interval of at least 1-1.5 meters in relation to the vehicle being overtaken. Drivers of motor vehicles and towed buses must additionally consider that the lateral movement of the trailer increases the dynamic corridor of the transport unit by 10-40%. In this case, a safe lateral interval should not be less than 2 meters.

question: In extreme situations, the driver must reduce the stopping distance of the vehicle by:
explanation: In extreme situations, reducing the stopping distance of a vehicle is achieved by repeatedly applying sharp forces to the brake pedal at the threshold of wheel locking.

answers.answer: Single sharp braking until full lock of the wheels.
On the verge of blocking the counts with multiple sharp impacts on the brake pedal.

question: In the case of increasing the speed of a vehicle in a turn, the significance of the centripetal force:
explanation: When increasing speed while turning a vehicle, the centrifugal force increases.

question: In low light conditions or during night-time, when approaching the top of a hill, the driver of the vehicle must turn off the high-beam headlights and switch on the low-beam headlights.
explanation: In dark conditions or when visibility is insufficient, as the driver approaches the top of a slope, they must turn off the high beams and switch on the low beams in any case.

answers.answer: In any case, as you approach the top of the hill.
Only upon the appearance of a meeting transport means.

question: The force of tire-road interaction when increasing the speed of the vehicle:
explanation: As the speed of the vehicle increases, the force of tire adhesion with the road decreases.

question: If the driver of a vehicle suddenly encounters a slippery short section while driving on the right road, they must:
explanation: If the driver of a vehicle suddenly encounters a slippery short section while driving on the correct road, they must continue driving along the same trajectory without changing speed.

answers.answer: Slow down the speed of movement with a single sharp braking.
To reduce the speed of movement with multiple passive brakes.
Continue to move along the same trajectory without changing the speed of movement.

question: After overcoming a water obstacle, in the case of wetting the brake pads, the driver of the vehicle must restore the effectiveness of the brakes by:
explanation: After overcoming a water obstacle, in the case of wet brake linings, to restore the effectiveness of the vehicle's brakes, the driver should continue driving and dry the brake linings by repeatedly pressing the brake pedal briefly.

answers.answer: Continue the movement and release the brake pads on the torpedo by repeatedly pressing the foot briefly.
The stationary vehicle with a partially lifted brake lever should move.
Continue to move with caution until the repair location.

question: According to the technical requirements set for motor vehicles, the paired wheels should be installed in such a way that the condition of their disk ventilation holes ensures:
explanation: "According to paragraph 3 of article 8 of the technical regulation approved by the Decree №30 of the Government of Georgia on January 3, 2014, the coupled weights must be installed in such a way that the condition of their disk ventilation openings ensures the possibility for both tire wear and pressure measurement."

answers.answer: The ability to measure both the inflation of the tires and the pressure.
Only the ability to measure tire pressure.
Only the possibility of tire inflation.

question: According to the technical requirements imposed on motor vehicles, it is mandatory for the vehicle to be in working condition:
explanation: "The technical requirements for motor vehicles, for which testing for roadworthiness is conducted to determine compliance and its methods," according to point 19 of article 9 of the technical regulation approved by the Resolution №30 of the Government of Georgia of January 3, 2014, states that "the locks of vehicle doors, the loading platform sidewall, the filling nozzle of tanks, mechanisms for fixing and adjusting the driver's and passengers' seats, the sound signal, the defrosting and heating apparatus for the windshield, the anti-theft device provided by the manufacturer, the emergency door switch and stop signal, emergency exits for buses and their operating devices, interior lighting switches of the bus cabin, door control actuator and their operation signaling must be in working condition."

answers.answer: Only door control actuators and locks
Only the cargo platform side panels.
All devices listed in this ticket

question: Which bus devices' operational condition is not required by the technical requirements set for motor vehicles?
explanation: According to Paragraph 19 of Article 9 of the Technical Regulation approved by the Resolution No. 30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014, "the locks of the doors of motor vehicles, the securing mechanism of the cargo platform, the discharge mechanism for tankers, the mechanisms for securing and adjusting the seats of drivers and passengers, the sound signal, the windshield wiper and heating device, the anti-theft device provided by the manufacturer, the emergency door release, and the stop signal, the emergency exits of buses and the devices leading to their operation, the interior lighting switches of the bus salon, the drive of the door control and their operation signaling must be in working condition."

answers.answer: Only emergency exits and the devices leading to their operation.
It is mandatory for all the devices listed in this ticket to be in working condition.

question: In dark conditions or under insufficient visibility, the driver must choose the speed of the vehicle's movement in such a way that the stopping distance is:
explanation: In dark times of day or under conditions of insufficient visibility, the driver must choose the speed of the vehicle's movement in such a way that the stopping distance is less than the visible range.

question: Which exterior lighting devices of a vehicle ensure better visibility of the road during nighttime and heavy snowfall conditions?
explanation: In the dark hours of the day, under heavy snowfall, it is advisable to switch on fog lights along with low beam headlights to ensure better visibility on the road.

answers.answer: Fog lights along with high beam headlights
Fog lights together with low beam headlights.

question: To stop skidding caused by braking, the driver of the vehicle must:
explanation: To stop skidding caused by braking, the driver of the vehicle should stop braking.

answers.answer: Continue to brake without changing the pressure on the pedal.

question: According to the technical requirements set for motor vehicles, it is not permissible to:
explanation: According to paragraphs 6 and 7 of Article 8 of the Technical Regulation approved by the Resolution No. 30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014, regarding the technical requirements for motor vehicles, which are tested for roadworthiness and the methods of conducting such tests: 6. It is not allowed to have even one missing bolt or nut for securing the discs, or their weak fastening. 7. The presence of cracks on the discs is not allowed.

answers.answer: The absence of even one screw or anchor for securing the disks, or their weak capture.
The presence of cracks only on the discs.
The absence of even one bolt or clip for securing the disks, or their weak tightening, as well as the presence of cracks on the disks.

question: The operation of motorcycles and mopeds is prohibited if the remaining tread depth of the tire is:
explanation: The operation of motorcycles and mopeds is prohibited if the remaining height of the tire tread is less than 0.8 mm.

answers.answer: It is more than 0.8 mm but less than 1.6 mm.
It is more than 1.6 mm but less than 2 mm.

question: According to the technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, the tread depth of passenger car tires must be at least:
explanation: According to subparagraph "a" of the first paragraph of the first article of the technical regulation approved by the Ordinance №30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014, regarding the technical requirements for motor vehicles for which testing is conducted to determine compliance with road worthiness and methods for conducting such tests, the tread depth of tires must be at least: a) for light vehicles – 1.6 mm.

question: According to the technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, the tread depth of tires for trucks must be at least:
explanation: "The technical requirements imposed on motor vehicles, for which the testing for roadworthiness is conducted to establish compliance and the methods of conducting it," according to subparagraph "g" of the first paragraph of the first article of the technical regulation approved by the Resolution No. 30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014, the tread depth of tires must be no less than: g) for trucks – 1.0 mm.

question: According to the technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, the tread depth of bus tires must be no less than:
explanation: "The technical requirements for motor vehicles, for which roadworthiness testing is conducted to determine compliance and the methods of conducting such testing," according to subsection "d" of the first point of the first article of the technical regulation approved by the resolution No. 30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014, the tread depth of tires must be at least: d) for buses – 2.0 mm.

question: Is the operation of a vehicle prohibited if the tire does not match the size or allowable load of the vehicle model?
explanation: The operation of a vehicle is prohibited if the tire does not match the vehicle's model in size or allowable load.

question: If it is not specified in the manufacturer's operating document, the total play in the steering system of the passenger car must not exceed:
explanation: "The technical requirements for motor vehicles, for which testing for roadworthiness is conducted to determine compliance and its methods," according to paragraph 3 point "a" of article 5 of the technical regulation approved by the decree No. 30 of the Government of Georgia on January 3, 2014, states that the total inclination in the steering system should not exceed the limit value specified in the manufacturer's operational document; if such values are not indicated, then the following limit values apply: a) for passenger cars and cargo vehicles and buses based on them – 10°.

question: If the manufacturer's operational document does not specify, the total play in the bus steering system should not exceed:
explanation: According to paragraph "b" of subsection 3 of article 5 of the technical regulation approved by the Government of Georgia's decree No. 30 dated January 3, 2014, regarding the technical requirements set forth for motor vehicles, whose compliance is determined by testing for roadworthiness and the methods of conducting such testing, the total roll angle in the steering control system must not exceed the maximum value specified in the manufacturer's operating document, and if such values are not indicated, then the following maximum values apply: b) for buses – 20°.

question: If the manufacturer's operating document does not specify, the total play in the steering system of the freight vehicle must not exceed:
explanation: "The technical requirements imposed on motor vehicles, for the determination of compliance with which road-worthiness testing is carried out and the methods of conducting it," according to subparagraph "g" of paragraph 3 of Article 5 of the technical regulation approved by the Order No. 30 of the Government of Georgia on January 3, 2014, the total play in the steering system shall not exceed the limiting value specified in the manufacturer's operational document, and if such values are not indicated, the following limiting values shall apply: g) for trucks – 25°.

explanation: The correct hand placement on the steering wheel allows the driver to quickly and easily turn the wheel in all directions and return it to the starting position in case of an emergency situation. question: The difference between the radii drawn from the center of the turn to the front moving on the opposite side and the rear moving on the turn side while turning is called:
explanation: The lane necessary for the movement of trucks and buses significantly widens when turning. When turning, the front wheels of the vehicle occupy the side opposite to the center of the turn, while the rear wheels of the vehicle or trailer are on the side towards the center of the turn. The difference between the radii extending from the center of the turn to the front wheels moving away from the center and the rear wheels moving toward the center is referred to as the vehicle's dynamic corridor.

answers.answer: The turning radius of the vehicle.

question: According to the technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, which malfunction of the braking system listed below is unacceptable?
explanation: "The technical requirements set for road transport vehicles, for which testing for roadworthiness is conducted to determine compliance and its methods," according to paragraphs 15 and 16 of Article 4 of the technical regulation approved by the Decree No. 30 of the Government of Georgia dated January 3, 2014: 15. The non-satisfactory operation of the manually operated brake control valve, leakage, damage, deformation or excessive wear of its controller is not allowed. 16. The malfunction of the handbrake mechanism, excessive movement of the lever is not allowed."

answers.answer: Unsatisfactory operation of the manually operated brake control valve, leakage, damage, deformation of its controller, or excessive wear.
Any malfunctions listed in this ticket
Only the rumble of the handbrake indicates a malfunction in the mechanism, excessive play in the lever.

question: According to the technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, which of the following malfunctions of the braking system is unacceptable?
explanation: "The technical requirements set for automotive vehicles, for which testing for roadworthiness is conducted and methods for its execution" according to Article 4, paragraphs 9 and 17 of the technical regulation approved by the resolution №30 of the Government of Georgia on January 3, 2014: 9. The signaling and control system of the braking systems, the pressure gauges of the pneumatic and pneumo-hydraulic braking actuators, and the fixing device of the parking brake system's control element must be in working order. 17. Damage to brake valves (reduction valves and regulators) is not permitted, excessive air leakage, excessive oil leakage from the compressor, unreliable installation, and fluid leakage from the hydraulic brake.

answers.answer: Only fluid leakage from the hydraulic brake.
Only the malfunction of pneumatic and pneumo-hydraulic brake actuator manometers.
Any malfunctions listed in this ticket.

question: According to the Administrative Offenses Code of Georgia, violating the safety rules for transporting children in a vehicle or violating traffic rules regarding pedestrians, as stipulated by Article 25 of the Law of Georgia on "Road Traffic," by the driver of the vehicle, results in:
explanation: According to paragraph 11 of Article 1271 of the Administrative Offenses Code of Georgia, violating safety rules for transporting children by vehicle will result in a fine of 40 lari.

answers.answer: A fine of 50 lari or suspension of the vehicle driving license for up to 30 days.

question: Is the operation of the vehicle prohibited if the number, type, and operation mode of the external lighting devices do not comply with the requirements of the vehicle's design?
explanation: According to the third paragraph of Article 7 of the technical regulation approved by the Government of Georgia's resolution No. 30 dated January 3, 2014, regarding "Technical requirements for motor vehicles for which compliance assessment is carried out through roadworthiness testing and its methods," the installation of external lighting devices from other brands and models is permitted on vehicles that have been withdrawn from production. question: Is it permissible to install tires with different treads on the same axle?
